Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Brussels

Type: Contract (6 Months)

Start Date: Mid-September




Your Role:




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting complex data, identifying trends, and providing valuable insights that will drive decision-making and innovation within the organisation. Your work will be crucial in optimising statistical efficiency and quality, as well as in developing strategies that enhance our data analytics capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse and interpret data using statistical techniques, providing ongoing reports to inform business decisions.
Develop and implement data analytics strategies to improve statistical efficiency and data quality.
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns within complex data sets to support business objectives.
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators, ensuring accuracy and reliability.
Work closely with management to prioritise business needs and identify new opportunities for process improvement.
Design and create data reports using Power BI, ensuring clarity and actionable insights.
Write and debug Python scripts for data manipulation and analysis.
Collaborate with teams and stakeholders to understand their business needs and translate them into effective data solutions.




What We’re Looking For:




At least 1 year of proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of reporting packages (e.g., Power BI), databases (e.g., SQL), and programming (e.g., Python).
Fluent in English; knowledge of Dutch or French is a plus.
Excellent ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong communication skills.
Experience with data warehousing, ETL tools, and other data visualization tools.
Experience with Tableau or QlikView is a plus.




Additional Information:




Location: Based in Brussels
Start Date: ASAP
Eligibility: Must possess a work permit for Belgium and a valid residence permit if not an EU citizen.




If this role is of interest apply now or if you have any additional questions send me an email on callum.earnshaw@hunterphilips.com.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Brussels for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

About The Job


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of predictive modelling
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer


Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand
Great compensation


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, Dax and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst/data engineer

Our organisation is gaining maturity at the level of data management, data engineering and BI reporting. An experienced Data Analyst/Data engineer is needed in this context.

Main focus will be to support business in the creation & documentation of various reporting and dashboards (Payment transactions, Accounting, KYC, Logistics...).

The analyst will also have the opportunity to take part in some business and functional analyses activities.




As a Data Analyst/Data Engineer (s)he should be able to :

Communicate efficiently with business departments to gather, understand and translate business needs into clear requirements.
Get a clear view of all the data sources and data available
Identify which data are required to build the expected extraction and reporting
Collect and integrate data and perform data preparation and transformations in a secure manner, in order to produce reusable key data sets
Use these key data sets to produce reportings and analysis for our internal customers as well as regulatory reportings
Create clear documentation on the data collection and transformations




For this, you should be able to :

Build reports via Salesforce reporting module and/or build dashboards via Tableau or Power BI.
Create insights and do storytelling
Export, merge and transform data with Power Query in case the data have not been integrated yet ; data security by design is key !
Ensure data quality by implementing controls on the imported and produced data.
Discover trends and insights that could bring value to the business.
Organise and document functionally implemented data integrations and reports




requirements

Fluently in Dutch, French & English




Required experience and knowledge Solid practical experience as a data engineer of at least 5 years is needed in the activities listed on the Function Description for which resource needs to take the lead.




You have a solid IT background and know all about data modelling, data documentation, data collecting and transforming and GDPR/data protection, building good data structures.

You've worked in a BI context previously (Accounting, Billing, payment transaction, terminal management environment), capturing and delivering data in a structured manner, with reusable key data sets. You have developed dashboards and reportings. You know do's and don'ts to build such deliverables.




Technical skills:

Good experience with IT activities (data models, API, data manipulation and transformation (doc included)
Excel (PowerPivot, PowerQuery...) ; Experience with market ETL/ELT tools is an advantage.
Salesforce reporting / Salesforce analytic Studio
Tableau dashboarding
Modelling technique (UML...)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join Revpanda.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data related to revenue, client, player behavior, registrations, FTD (First-Time Depositors), payback, and marketing efforts. Your insights will support strategic decisions and optimize our marketing and operational strategies.







Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Analysis: Gather, process, and analyze data from various sources, including player behavior, registration, FTD, payback, and marketing and financial campaigns.
Reporting & Dashboards: Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Insights & Recommendations: Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in the data, providing actionable insights and recommendations to improve business outcomes.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, product development, and operational teams to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights.
Market Analysis: Conduct market and competitor analysis to identify opportunities for growth and optimization.
Data Integrity: Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks and validation processes.
Visualization: Create clear and effective data visualizations to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.







Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the iGaming, digital marketing, or related industries.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software such as SQL, Excel, Looker Studio, Power BI, or similar.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with digital marketing metrics and iGaming industry trends.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
Experience with A/B testing and data-driven experimentation.




What we offer:

Friendly and supportive colleagues
Diverse opportunities for professional growth and career development
Possibility to take part in international conferences and online courses
Competitive salary
Birthday day off
"Refer a friend" bonus
Corporate events
LinkedIn Learning complimentary access

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

  • 1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)


WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.


YOUR TASKS :

  • You understand the business request
  • You dive into a large amount of data :
  1. Collecting and interpreting data
  2. Analyzing results
  3. Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
  4. Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
  • You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
  • In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data


HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

  • You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
  • You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
  • You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
  • You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
  • You pay attention to details
  • You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset


WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

  • A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
  • You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
  • You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
  • You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
  • We have values we share, live with and experiment every day


We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!


"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description


Aarixa is an independent Belgian ICT company that has been active since 1995, specializing in defining and optimizing solutions for SMEs and large international companies. The company has offices in Herk-de-Stad and Brussels, with an offshore office in the Philippines. Aarixa focuses on building long-term client relationships, delivering the right solutions, and prioritizing stability and quality over quantity. The core business areas include IT Consultancy, Project Staffing, and In-House & Offshore Software Development.


Role Description


This is a full-time hybrid role for a Data Analyst at Aarixa located in the Brussels Metropolitan Area, with flexibility for remote work. The Data Analyst will be responsible for day-to-day tasks such as analyzing data, applying statistical techniques, communicating insights, and creating data models to support business decision-making.


Qualifications

Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics proficiency
Strong Communication skills
Data Modeling expertise
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a global European HQ'd biotech that has grown 90% in the past two years and has seen huge success with recent launches - their stocks/shares have absolutely rocketed as a result.




They are looking for a Subject Matter Expert (Data Analytics) to join their Business Information Systems team. Within this role you will be working in close collaboration with Quality and Regulatory teams, understanding, anticipating and influencing the demand for services and translating requirements into efficient and harmonised solutions. You would be working with Snowflake, Veeva and Matilion so need strong experience with these tools/systems.

Title: Sports Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and inquisitive Business Analyst with strong SQL knowledge and previous experience in gaming with heavy focus on sport. Must have experience with reporting tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker. The ideal candidate will demonstrate curiosity, attention to detail, analytical thinking, and strong collaboration skills. Python skills are a plus for this role.

The candidate will work closely with our casino team to create dashboards and produce meaningful insights through data analysis.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the casino team to understand their business objectives, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and prioritize dashboard enhancements.
Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from various databases and sources.
Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker, or similar reporting tools.
Validate data integrity, ensure data accuracy, and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Maintain and optimize existing dashboards and reports, in addition to creating new ones.




Requirements:

Experience in the gaming industry, particularly within Casino and Sports.
Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating databases.
Experience in data analytics and visualization tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills.
Python or any other Programming Language skills are a plus.

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
Keystone Solutions is seeking a talented Data & BI Analyst for a consultancy mission within the Daily Banking Tribe at a client location. This role is designed for a professional eager to leverage their data analytics expertise to influence strategic financial decisions. As a Keystone consultant, you will be instrumental in helping the clients Tribe optimize their financial products, such as Debit Cards, Credit Cards, Cash Accounts, and Saving Accounts, by providing actionable insights through data analysis and dashboard development.

Key Responsibilities:

Stakeholder Management:


Business Requirements: Engage with management and product-related roles to gather comprehensive business requirements.
Cross-Department Collaboration: Work closely with the Finance and Data Departments to ensure alignment and data accuracy.
Dashboard Promotion: Actively promote and explain the value of the dashboards within the Tribe, ensuring they are effectively utilized.



Financial Strategic Management:


Financial Insights: Analyze and understand the financials and their key drivers within the Product Tribe to guide strategic decisions.
Steering Facilitation: Provide data-driven insights to support the steering of the Tribe's financial performance.



Data Tools & Dashboard Development:


Data Sourcing: Identify relevant data sources to support business needs.
Data Preparation & Automation: Handle data preparation, query development, and automation/scheduling tasks.
Tableau Expertise: Develop and maintain dashboards using Tableau to present clear and actionable data insights.



Qualifications:

Education:


Masters degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, engineering, or commercial engineering. Candidates with other academic backgrounds who possess substantial knowledge of analytics are also encouraged to apply.



Experience:


Required: 2 to 6 years of relevant experience in Data Analytics.
Technical Proficiency: Expertise in data sourcing, preparation, automation, and Tableau for dashboard development.
Business Acumen: Strong understanding of financial drivers and strategic management within a Product Tribe.
Stakeholder Management: Experience in gathering business requirements and promoting deliverables across departments.
Preferable: Knowledge of Daily Banking products.



Soft Skills:


Team player with a proactive attitude.
Strong communication and influencing skills.
Excellent analytical and synthesis abilities.
Ability to work autonomously with commitment and perseverance.
Capable of thriving in a dynamic and multicultural environment.



Why Join Keystone Solutions?

As a consultant with Keystone Solutions, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse and challenging client projects that will accelerate your professional growth. Our dynamic consultancy model provides you with the tools, support, and development opportunities to achieve your career ambitions while making a tangible impact on client success.

This position is not just a job; its a chance to advance your expertise in data and BI analytics while shaping the future of banking products. Join Keystone Solutions, where your skills will be valued, and your growth will be limitless.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
bpostgroup strives to create an inclusive environment with challenging projects and inspiring collaborations. With our employees at the heart of our organization, we don’t believe in jobs, we believe in careers. We're now looking for a senior reporting analist who will make us move. ​

​

Your mission:

The Senior Reporting Analyst plays a key role in the follow-up and evaluation of bpost’s operational activities, by providing accurate up-to-date data in the form of dashboards, operational reports and end-to-end scorecards, thus enabling field teams to quickly take corrective actions where needed, helping performance controllers to keep budget and operations under control and providing business leaders the necessary foundation to take pertinent decisions for bpost’s roadmap.

Advanced knowledge is required both on backend IT systems to ensure smooth and reliable wrangling of data coming from massive data sources, as well as modern frontend reporting interfaces to present the data in a sleek, fit-for-use and fit-for-purpose jacket.

He/she will support, collaborate and build long lasting relationships with internal key stakeholders, continuously looking for and propose new ideas for potential improvements.

This role requires high organization and communication skills, the ability to work in teams or fly solo, and to manage multiple projects simultaneously. He/she should be able to continue to work meticulously under pressure at peak times, and be agile to work in an environment where change happens at a rapid pace.

​

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

​

· Understand business processes and assist the customer in finding the right solution for his problem

· Deliver quality analytic reports in timely fashion

· Familiarize oneself with the various data marts’ contents

· Follow up data projects from A to Z as pm, starting from Business Requirements to the final result including after care.

· Develop and manage flexible data extract solutions that allow effortless and reliable continuity

· Maximize the automation of report generation

· Build reports in a standardized and harmonized way (share with other teams)

· Ensure data quality by adding consistency checks to the reports

· Participate in test & QA phases of new releases and propose measurement data sets

· Continue to develop and simplify the reporting process and increase its efficiency

· Identify & analyze recurring issues and propose solutions

· Keep up-to-date with the latest technologies at hand

· Be or become the Subject Matter Expert of a set of channels/products and act as SPOC within the team

· Present new reports to the relevant internal customers

​

​Your profile:​​

We do not only deliver letters and parcels, but also opportunities. This job is open to all with diverse backgrounds and talents, possessing the following skills: ​

​

· A talented colleague with strong analytical and communication skills who picks things up quickly, has an eye for detail and likes to make things happen.

· You embrace challenges in a fast changing and complex environment and thrive well in a team environment, taking others along on your growth journey.

​

· You have 3-7 years’ experience in analyzing business needs and translating them into clear reports, using mainstream and new data manipulation and reporting tools such as:

o MS Excel

o Visualisation (PowerBi)

o SAP Business Objects

o SQL

o ETL_Tool (Knime; Access)

o Programming languages (VBA; DAX; M; Perl)

· Expertise in similar tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, …) is considered as an asset. Knowledge of other programming languages is considered as an asset as well (Python) even as experience in a logistics environment.

· You speak fluent Dutch or French and understand the other language, and have business knowledge of English.

​

Our offer: ​

Like a long-awaited parcel, we want to make you feel welcome and valued. Our offer includes: ​

· Competitive monthly salary​

· Meal vouchers​

· Hospitalization-, group- and disability insurances​

· 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extralegal days off ​

· An end-of-year and performance-based bonus and double holiday pay ​

· Many benefits from more than 100 bpost-partners​

​

Why bpostgroup?​

bpostgroup is Belgium's leading postal operator and a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner globally. With a focus on social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world. As our newest team member you will: ​

· Become part of the bpostgroup family with a unique atmosphere and culture.​

· Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a hybrid model allowing for flexibility.​

· Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.​

· Have a direct impact on decision-making in an international success story.​

· Thrive in a leadership culture centered on visioning, sense making, innovation, and relating, empowering you to lead effectively in our forward-thinking organization.​

​

Find out more about bpostgroup​​

​

No match? ​

Explore other exciting job opportunities with us.​

​

More info? ​

Feel free to reach out to Marissa Sorgeloos

Show more

· Become part of the bpostgroup family with a unique atmosphere and culture.​

· Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a hybrid model allowing for flexibility.​

· Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.​

· Have a direct impact on decision-making in an international success story.​

· Thrive in a leadership culture centered on visioning, sense making, innovation, and relating, empowering you to lead effectively in our forward-thinking organization.​

​

Find out more about bpostgroup​​

​

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
You’ll be part of the Strategy team, working closely with senior management and focusing on the business lines of Telenet, BASE, and Tadaam for both segments: a) residential and b) SOHO (small office home office).




Here are some key points about the role:

Your tasks as a Data & Insights Analyst

Identify & Prioritize Insights: Work with business unit’s facilitators and senior management to determine key insights and reporting needs.
Build & Communicate Dashboards: Create and share KPI dashboards that map business unit’s performance.
Recommend Improvements: Proactively suggest areas for performance enhancement.
Collaborate on Deep Dives: Work with Data & Insights specialists to synthesize complex insights into actionable recommendations.
Monitor Business Planning: Assist with budget and forecast updates, creating insights with business stakeholders.
Support Colleagues: Help business colleagues with self-service tools.




What we have to offer

Strategic Department: Gain a broad view of strategic projects and P&Ls.
Personal Development: Opportunities for internal mobility and extensive learning opportunities. Along with chance to press the pause button after a while or take another path.
Work-Life Balance: A supportive environment that adapts to your needs.
Financial incentives: A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, cell phone, option for a car, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, possibility to work from home,.).

It’s a dynamic and fast-paced environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. Does this role align with what you’re looking for in your next career move?




Our ideal D&I Analyst has …

Minimum 2-3 years' experience as a data or business analyst or similar roles
Master's degree in an economic, technical or economic field (Commercial Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, Digital...) or similar experience
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills. We value different points of view.
Strong analytical & result oriented skills
Can naturally assume problem solving thinking and has great impact on decision makers
Knowledge and experience in telecom, media or consulting or similar industries is a plus




Apply? Good idea!

Fancy a job with content and variety? Become D&I Analyst at Telenet. Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wil jij een cruciale rol spelen in het optimaliseren van data-gedreven besluitvorming binnen BMW Financial Services ? Als Data Analyst ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen. Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools, genereert waardevolle inzichten en ondersteunt de business bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.




Met jouw sterke analytische vaardigheden, technische kennis en communicatieve talent, ben jij de ideale kandidaat om ons team te versterken. Solliciteer nu en maak het verschil!




Wat doe je als Data Analyst?

Je implementeert geavanceerde data- en informatiemanagement oplossingen, met als doel het gebruik van rapportages, informatie en data in het hele bedrijf te optimaliseren.
Je stemt de implementatie van nieuwe bedrijfsoplosssing af met interne stakeholders.
Je waarborgt de kwaliteit van de data d.m.v. data testings en een optimaal data quality beleid.
Je visualiseert data met krachtige tools als Tableau (of Power BI).
Je zorgt voor waardevolle zakelijke inzichten door data-analyse en -modellering.
Je ondersteunt de organisatie bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.
Je treedt op als oplossingsarchitect op het gebied van interactieve rapportage en analyse.
Je maakt gebruik van bestaande systemen en functionaliteiten en stimuleert tegelijkertijd verdere innovatie.
Je ondersteunt de continue ontwikkeling van het rapportage- en analyselandschap en helpt bij de toepassing van AI en Machine Learning.




Waarmee kan je ons team versterken?

Je beschikt over sterke organisatorische, analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je kan je bevindingen en technische concepten op een vlotte, effectieve manier presenteren en overbrengen.
Je bent leergierig en vindt het belangrijk om nieuwe informatie en vaardigheden te leren, op te nemen en toe te passen.
Je hebt ervaring opgebouwd in data-analyse en data quality management.
Kennis van Microsoft Office-toepassingen.
Kennis van SQL en Tableau (of Power BI).
Kennis van DW-concepten, -processen en -methodologie.
Kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira
Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en het Engels, zowel gesproken als geschreven.




What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.




We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.




Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Show more

  • Je zorgt voor waardevolle zakelijke inzichten door data-analyse en -modellering.
  • Je ondersteunt de organisatie bij het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen.
  • Je treedt op als oplossingsarchitect op het gebied van interactieve rapportage en analyse.
  • Je maakt gebruik van bestaande systemen en functionaliteiten en stimuleert tegelijkertijd verdere innovatie.
  • Je ondersteunt de continue ontwikkeling van het rapportage- en analyselandschap en helpt bij de toepassing van AI en Machine Learning.


Waarmee kan je ons team versterken?

  • Je beschikt over sterke organisatorische, analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je kan je bevindingen en technische concepten op een vlotte, effectieve manier presenteren en overbrengen.
  • Je bent leergierig en vindt het belangrijk om nieuwe informatie en vaardigheden te leren, op te nemen en toe te passen.
  • Je hebt ervaring opgebouwd in data-analyse en data quality management.
  • Kennis van Microsoft Office-toepassingen.
  • Kennis van SQL en Tableau (of Power BI).
  • Kennis van DW-concepten, -processen en -methodologie.
  • Kennis van collaboration tools zoals Confluence en Agile tools zoals Jira
  • Je bent vloeiend in het Nederlands en het Engels, zowel gesproken als geschreven.


What's in it for you?

Als je bij ons opstart, kom je terecht bij een premium speler met een internationaal en innovatief karakter. We zetten sterk in op doorgroeimogelijkheden en helpen onze werknemers mee te groeien met onze onderneming door een aangepast opleidingsaanbod te voorzien.


We kiezen voor een hybride, flexibele manier van werken, waarbij we kantoordagen afwisselen met thuiswerkdagen. Zo heb je de mogelijkheid als fulltime medewerker om twee dagen per week van thuis uit te werken.


Daarnaast bieden wij een aantrekkelijk én gepersonaliseerd loonpakket aan dankzij ons Flex Income Plan. Hierin bepaal je zelf welke loonelementen je wenst op te nemen, zoals bijvoorbeeld een lease-auto of -fiets, extra vakantiedagen, multimedia... Verder geniet je van tal van extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. maaltijdcheques, een hospitalisatieverzekering en een groepsverzekering.

Title: Manager - Data Analyst
Description:
At Mangopay, our mission is to power the payment infrastructure and payment operations of the world's biggest and most exciting marketplaces & platforms.

We provide marketplaces and platforms with powerful modular payment and regulatory solutions. Since 2013, we have enabled the success of some of the biggest names in e-commerce, retail, and cutting-edge platforms such as Vinted, Rakuten, Chrono24, La Redoute, Wallapop and over 2,500+ more.

Our team of 400+ is spread across Europe, with offices in Berlin, Dublin, Luxembourg, London, Madrid, Paris, and Warsaw. In an environment where marketplaces and fintech ventures are thriving, we're actively seeking exceptional individuals to tackle the challenges in our field and contribute to our growth. Our commitment to diversity is unwavering, and we are dedicated to promoting employee well-being, inclusivity, and equal opportunities. Joining Mangopay means you’ll be part of a dynamic, flexible, and rapidly growing team.

Job Description

What you'll be doing:


Enable our stakeholders to make informed decisions based on data.
Collaborate directly with every department in Mangopay, including C-level, to provide high-quality analytics.
Educate the organization on how to leverage data effectively. That means you’ll become a go-to person regarding all our data and its use cases.
Lead, organize, and support the professional growth of the team.



What we would love you to bring with you:


2+ years of team management experience
Experience in data modeling in Looker, statistics, and working with data warehouses (Snowflake)
Previous experience in the financial services industry
Fluently speak English and enjoy working with many stakeholders.
Demonstrate a strong bias for action, customer obsession, and being right (a lot).



We care about equal employment opportunities, so all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration regardless of their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a remote position.

Freelance job for a French / Duch speaking Data Analyst in Belgium. 12 month contract

Job Overview: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with proficiency in SAS and Azure to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to leverage data to inform business decisions. This role involves working with cross-functional teams to collect, process, and analyze data, ensuring accuracy and integrity, and developing insights that drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:


Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets using SAS.
Develop, implement, and maintain data models, reports, and dashboards in Azure.
Collaborate with business units to identify data needs and provide actionable insights.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across various data sources.
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to support business objectives.
Create and maintain documentation for data processes, analysis methodologies, and reporting.
Support ad-hoc data requests and projects as needed.
Continuously improve data collection and analysis processes.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in SAS for data manipulation, analysis, and reporting.
Experience with Azure data services (Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Databricks, etc.).
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Proficiency in SQL for querying databases.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s degree in a related field.
Experience with additional programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Certification in SAS and/or Azure.

Title: EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)
Description:
Profil du candidat

Langues : Français Néerlandais. L'anglais est un plus.
Master académique ou équivalent par l'expérience professionnelle (science des données, statistiques, ingénierie, informatique).
Solide expérience analytique/mathématique avec une grande attention aux détails.
Expérience en gestion/analyse/science des données.
Résolveur de problèmes indépendant ; agile et pragmatique.
Solides compétences organisationnelles. Bonne capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
Capacité à communiquer clairement des informations sur les données (y compris la capacité à structurer des présentations de gestion).
Ne pas avoir peur de plonger dans les modèles statistiques, la modélisation prédictive, les algorithmes de classification, les arbres de décision, le clustering, etc.
Affinité avec les opérations commerciales.
Volonté d'évoluer dans un environnement en constante évolution.

Activités
Coordonner la collecte, l'agrégation, le traitement, l'analyse et le support des données :

Construire, exploiter et maintenir la plateforme/environnement Power BI (et sa connexion à l'entrepôt de données de TotalEnergies).
Concevoir et créer des tableaux de bord d'analyse de données et des modèles statistiques pour aider l'équipe EV à gérer les ventes, les opérations, le sourcing, les projets, etc.
Développer des modèles de prévision et d'analyse de localisation pour l'expansion du réseau de recharge (semi)public.
Développer et soutenir l'échange de données vers et depuis les applications/outils EV et les systèmes ERP pertinents (externes).
Agir en tant que contributeur clé de l'équipe Solutions pour les solutions innovantes axées sur les données (par exemple, la recharge intelligente, la maintenance prédictive, etc.)
Agir en tant qu'expert de première ligne en matière d'analyse de données et d'outils pour l'équipe chargée de la recharge des véhicules électriques.
Collecte, agrégation, synthèse et intégration des données externes du marché des VE

Responsable des rapports, du soutien au contrôle de gestion et de la fourniture de données à des tiers :

Fournisseur clé de données sur le réseau de recharge (performance et déploiement) à la direction pour la prise de décisions stratégiques.
Mise en place, suivi et enrichissement des données de performance clés.
Collaborer avec l'équipe des opérations pour identifier les problèmes opérationnels.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de contrôle de gestion pour structurer les résultats à partager avec la direction.
Collaborer avec l'équipe Solutions pour les développements matériels et logiciels.
Assurer la liaison avec les fournisseurs informatiques internes et externes et le département informatique de TotalEnergies sur les projets de données et signaler les déviations et les opportunités.
Suivre et étudier activement les tendances du marché des VE et partager les informations pertinentes avec l'organisation et la direction.

Contexte et environnement
TotalEnergies Charging Solutions Belgium est une filiale essentielle pour soutenir TotalEnergies dans son engagement pour une meilleure énergie. Ce jeune département se développe rapidement pour répondre à l'énorme transition en cours, et est donc en constante évolution. TSCB est donc la recherche d’un.e :
EV Data Analyst Business Intelligence Specialist (H/F/X)
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!




A little bit about us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.




How you will make a difference:




Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends.
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team.
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets.
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets.
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers.
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok.
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations.
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes.
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards.




Requirements




Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms.
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.




Perks of being one of us




Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks




Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.




Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Data Management & Analytics
Description:
Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:


Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English


Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer


An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Our company is an industry leader committed to pushing the boundaries of technology and innovation. We are looking for a talented Data Analyst with expertise in Tableau and SQL to join our team. This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on impactful data projects and contribute to our mission of leveraging data to drive business insights and strategic decisions.




Job Summary

As a Data Analyst at, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, creating insightful visualizations, and providing actionable recommendations to support business objectives. Using Tableau and SQL, you will work closely with various teams to translate data into clear and meaningful insights.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau.
Write and optimize SQL queries to extract and manipulate data from relational databases.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Present findings and recommendations to management and other key stakeholders.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous data validation and quality checks.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.




Must Have

Proven experience as a Data Analyst with a strong focus on Tableau and SQL.
Expertise in developing and designing interactive dashboards and visualizations in Tableau.
Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries and working with relational databases.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable insights.
Experience with data cleaning, transformation, and validation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present data-driven insights effectively.




Nice to Have

Familiarity with other data visualization tools or BI platforms such as Power BI or Looker.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes.
Knowledge of statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.
Experience with Python or R for advanced data analysis and scripting.




About Worky:

Worky is an on-demand talent cloud platform that seamlessly connects companies with remote and vetted professionals globally. Positioned to redefine the landscape of the on-demand talent industry, Worky stands as the foremost provider of vetted talent in data, software engineering, and product development. Our esteemed clientele relies on us to access top-tier talent for remote positions, and Worky's rapidly expanding global talent network empowers both established organizations and startups to meet their diverse hiring needs at any scale.

Central to our operations is Worky's sourcing process, which revolutionizes the talent vetting and matching process, delivering engaged and qualified professionals with unprecedented speed.

The key advantages of partnering with Worky include our overarching mission, a vast global network, a commitment to guaranteed quality, cutting-edge technology integration, and a hyper-personalized and proactive approach to talent acquisition.

To explore how Worky can revolutionize your approach to talent acquisition, please visit us at https://worky.com/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Je komt terecht in de marketing tribe bij Telenet Business, de dynamische en groeiende B2B-circle binnen de Telenet groep. Nu B2B steeds meer datagedreven wordt, speel jij een cruciale rol in het overnemen van deze mindset en het verschaffen van de juiste inzichten. Je maakt deel uit van een klein dynamisch team dat verantwoordelijk is voor marketing intelligence, marketing automation, digital marketing en performance. De data analist werkt zeer nauw samen met de marketing collega's, zijn data analist collega's, data scientists maar ook met sales, solutions experts, business analisten.

Jouw rol als data analist


Als data analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het beheersen van commerciële data, zorg je ervoor dat deze door jou of andere collega's wordt opgeschoond en ondersteun je stakeholders met interessante business inzichten. Als je houdt van een verscheidenheid aan dataprojecten, in een complex datalandschap en om samen te werken met een veelheid aan stakeholders, dan ben jij onze persoon!
Je verzamelt, cleaned en valideert de gegevens die je nodig hebt uit verschillende bronnen.
Stelt klantenlijsten op, combineert relevante klant- en productgegevens om leadgeneratieacties, migraties en marketingacties voor te bereiden.
Zorg ervoor dat we de meest optimale gegevenskwaliteit in onze contacten hebben
Bepaal gegevensverbeteringen om ervoor te zorgen dat we de gegevenskwaliteit op peil houden en het beste halen uit de gegevens die we verzamelen
Stuur het commerciële team aan door bedrijfsinzichten en meer specifieke segmentinzichten te bieden. Ondersteun de business door nieuwe kansen te definiëren op basis van diepgaande data-analyse, suggesties om de prestaties te verbeteren, etc.
Creëer in Qlik nieuwe rapporten ter ondersteuning van zakelijke inzichten voor commerciële sturing.
Zorg ervoor dat we voldoen aan het GDPR-beleid van Telenet met betrekking tot B2B-klantgegevens.


We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analist met de volgende vaardigheden


Data-driven mindset met het vermogen om de juiste inhoudelijke KPI's vast te stellen en deze op te volgen.
Strong analytical and data skills, met kennis van Excel, SQL, SPSS en/of rapportageplatform. Ervaring met QlikSense is een voordeel.
Op je gemak zijn in een complexe omgeving met meerdere te beheren tools/bronnen
Samenwerken met een veelheid aan stakeholders van verschillende afdelingen binnen B2B
Goede presentatie- en vertelvaardigheden, zeker naar niet-data gedreven collega's
Een probleemoplossende en resultaatgerichte mindset
Uitstekende communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden in Nederlands en Engels, Frans is een pré.
Ervaring van minimaal 3-5 jaar als data/business/CRM-analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.


Wat kun je van ons verwachten?


Je komt terecht bij een bedrijf en een team die veel in je investeren en je werkomgeving waar mogelijk aanpassen aan je behoeften. We willen dat je jezelf ontwikkelt en zorgen tegelijkertijd voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé.
Je krijgt alle kansen om je expertise verder te ontwikkelen. We stimuleren je persoonlijke groei met interne mobiliteitsmogelijkheden en uitgebreide leermogelijkheden, maar geven je ook de kans om desgewenst op de pauzeknop te drukken of een heel ander pad in te slaan.
Een afwisselende baan waarin je tastbare resultaten zult boeken en je stempel zult drukken.
Een competitief bruto maandsalaris dat we aanvullen met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals kortingen op Telenet producten, maaltijdcheques, ... .
Een geweldig team van collega's die net zo gepassioneerd zijn als jij.
Je komt te werken in een geweldige moderne werkplek op Telenet HQ in Mechelen met de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week thuis te werken
Show more

Title: Digital Intelligence & Data Analyst
Description:
About Ogilvy Social.lab

Ogilvy Social.Lab (OSL) is a full-service advertising agency headquartered in Brussels’ WPP Campus. As part of the international Ogilvy network, our operations span four continents with over 15 nationalities on the 130-strong team working in our offices – our mindset is borderless.

We proudly collaborate with prominent international and regional clients, including Absolut, Mondelez, Ford, IKEA, Vans, EU and Belgian institutions, fueling their success internationally.

Entrepreneurship pulses through our veins, embodying our name with a "lab” mentality. We constantly innovate and experiment, staying in sync with the ever-evolving digital media landscape we specialize in.

Your Main Responsibilities


Analyse social and digital data through a set of tools (Social Listening tools like Synthesio, Competitive Analysis tools like RivalIQ, Audience Analysis tools like Profiler or Global Web Index, Trends and Search Analysis tools like Semrush or Social Lab Proprietary Tools, etc.) based on a client briefing. Develop custom approaches leveraging available data sets and technologies to deliver on actionable insights to inform strategic recommendations.
Support planners in developing data-validated strategies bringing data richness to what consumers, communities or creators are ‘saying’, ‘sharing’ and ‘searching’ online.
Design insightful reports and audits with strategic recommendations.
Deliver high-quality service to local and international clients.
Collaborate with WPP and external data providers.
Participate in the creation of new, commercially viable data products.
Client-facing for the presentation of intelligence work.


Your Track Record Shows


2 to 6 years of experience in Social/Digital/Search Data Analytics, Insights and Digital/Social Strategy (seniority level to be determined based on your background and experience).
Strong research and analytical skills - understand how to apply qualitative and quantitative learnings and turn them into actionable insights
Comfortable using social and digital monitoring technologies such as Synthesio, Brandwatch, Meltwater, Semrush, etc.
Expert in the understanding of social media and established understanding of the wider digital communication landscape.
Ability to work effectively, proactively and seamlessly amongst an integrated agency team.
Eye for innovation and the next emerging platform or partner.


Must-have


Always-on social listening analysis and insights generation.
Cultural tracking (including trends) and insights generation for always-on and campaign use.
A strong understanding of today’s social media landscape and internet culture (Social 3.0, culture-first, community and creators led, audience-first) and new channels’ codes.
A strong understanding of Social media performance metrics/KPIs for both organic and paid media.
Strong reporting and visualisation skills


Nice-to-have


Dashboarding, data collection and data visualisation experience
Sprinklr expertise
Knowledge of customer research is a plus


OFFER


Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels – the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency – Our words and promises produce actions.
Enjoy attractive employment benefits including:
Flexible working policy; balanced mix of remote work and in-office presence options
Meal & Eco vouchers,
Cafeteria plan,
3 insurance options,
Continuous training,
Latest collaborative tech and tools to thrive,
Teambuilding & integration activities, Lunch&Learns...
As an Ogilvy Social. Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training, and career conversations, while doing strong work, that works on a daily basis.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST
Description:
Dark Light specializes in the temporary deployment of talented professionals for data and business intelligence projects. We are currently seeking a Business Data Analyst for one of our major clients, a key player in the Financial landscape.

Tasks


Ability to perform in-depth data analyses in a dynamic and complex environment
Ability to document and communicate analysis results with colleagues
Gather user needs, considering the requirements of the target system and the data present in the source systems
Assignments with both functional and technical aspects
Knowledge of private banking
Thorough knowledge of SQL
Proficiency in French and English
Team player
Good communication skills with IT colleagues and users



Requirements


1-4 years of experience (junior/medior)
Experience in the banking sector (understanding of the banking industry & CRM – customer data)
SQL & Excel proficiency
Ability to communicate with technical profiles
Must be able to work independently



Benefits


Hybrid work
Freelance contract of one year (plus extensions)
Remuneration in line with experience

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Description:




As a medior Data Analyst, you have at least 2-5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...) to enable sound decision making :

- You identify and collect data using specific tools or techniques;

- You analyse and extract key data and information;

- You describe functional mapping towards targets;

- You model and define transformation rules to meet the organization's needs and requirements;

- You assist and participate in data validation and cleaning to ensure the quality and integrity of data throughout the whole chain;

- You provide reports that enable the 'business' in their decision making.

Next to a proven experience in data management, you have the following core competences : Agile Methodologies, Analytical thinking, Collaborating, Customer orientation, Data driven.




As a marketing analyst you are responsible for providing data-driven insights into the behavior of our (potential) customers, in order to continuously monitor and optimize the customer journey where necessary




Technical skills:

Adobe Analytics
Adobe Target
Google Analytics




Language skills:

Dutch
English

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

En tant que Marketing Data Analyst vous avez l’opportunité de repousser les limites du marketing. Vous plongez quotidiennement dans l’analyse de données et le reporting. Vous analysez notamment les tendances du marché et le comportement des clients afin de formuler des propositions novatrices pour des campagnes marketing qui marquent. Vos rapports sont essentiels pour la direction afin de pendre des décisions bien calibrées et pour marquer la stratégie marketing d’un acteur de premier plan dans notre industrie. Grâce à vous, tous les collaborateurs disposent des données dont ils ont besoin.

Ces Tâches Forment Votre Quotidien


Réaliser des analyses de marché très poussées qui permettent de prendre les bonnes décisions stratégiques. Vous traduisez des ensembles de données complexes dans des recommandations pratiques pour améliorer la notoriété de notre marque et stimuler nos ventes.
Création de rapports visuels accrocheurs dans Power BI à propos des machines vendues, les parts de marché, la prise de commande, le modèle et la business unit.
Analyse et révision annuelle du degré de couverture de nos commerciaux afin de déterminer quelles régions sont les mieux desservies. Mise à jour de ces données dans nos systèmes ERP et CRM.
Mise à jour de l’ensemble des dasboards sales/marketing dans notre CRM (Salesforce) et créez des nouveaux tableaux de bord si nécessaire.
Réalisation mensuelle de dashboards clairs concernant l’ensemble de nos actions de marketing digitales et vous formulez des recommandations pour optimiser ces campagnes.
Vous allez plus loin que les analyses marketing conventionnelles car vous créez des nouvelles ‘expériences client’. Ensuite, vous implémentez vos créations par le biais de Marketing Cloud Salesforce.
En tant que coordinateur du programme ‘Marketing & Sales Excellence’ vous travaillez avec les départements concernés afin d’atteindre les objectifs et assurer le suivi des actions.
Organisation et préparation des enquêtes de satisfaction client. Analyse des résultats et facilitation des initiatives d’amélioration de la satisfaction client.


Profiel kandidaat

Vous voulez un job dynamique dans une culture d’entreprise informelle. Vous êtes extrêmement analytique et bon communicateur. Votre œil aiguisé du détail et votre capacité de détecter des modèles/tendances dans un ensemble complexe de données, vous permettent d’implémenter vos stratégies marketing out-of-the box.

Vos Compétences


Diplôme de bachelor ou master en marketing ou une filière connexe.
Niveau de compétence avancé en Excel (Power Querry/vba), en Power BI (DAX) et en rapportage graphique/visuel.
De l’expérience avec la conduite d’analyses de marché et de la concurrence.
Très grande capacité analytique et de l’expérience avec des outils d’analyse de données.
D’excellentes capacités de communication et de présentation.
Bon bilingue néerlandais/français (écrit et parlé) et une très bonne maîtrise de l’anglais.
Minimum 3 ans d’expérience dans une fonction similaire.
De l’expérience avec Marketing Cloud et Salesforce Sales Cloud (data model) est un atout).
Orienté résultats : atteindre des résultats mesurables.
Suivre les dernières tendances dans le domaine du marketing, surtout l’analyse et le rapportage.
Réflexion out-of-the box et proposition de solutions iinnovantes.
Sens du détail et rigueur.
Orienté client et solutions.
Flexibilité.
Utilisation fluide des outils Office 365.


Geboden wordt


Un contrat à durée déterminée avec un salaire et des avantages extralégaux comme des chèques-repas, assurances (groupe, invalidité, hospitalisation), voiture,laptop, smartphone et un Flex Income Plan.
Un job chez le concessionnaire exclusif de machines Caterpillar.
Des jours de télétravail.
Bon équilibre entre vie privée et professionnelle = Happiness @ Work.
Une bonne ambiance de travail et des collègues sur lesquels on peut compter.
Formations.
Contacts internationaux au sein de Caterpillar et du Monnoyeur Group.


Meer informatie

HTML:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

En tant que Marketing Data Analyst vous avez l’opportunité de repousser les limites du marketing. Vous plongez quotidiennement dans l’analyse de données et le reporting. Vous analysez notamment les tendances du marché et le comportement des clients afin de formuler des propositions novatrices pour des campagnes marketing qui marquent. Vos rapports sont essentiels pour la direction afin de pendre des décisions bien calibrées et pour marquer la stratégie marketing d’un acteur de premier plan dans notre industrie. Grâce à vous, tous les collaborateurs disposent des données dont ils ont besoin.

Ces Tâches Forment Votre Quotidien

  • Réaliser des analyses de marché très poussées qui permettent de prendre les bonnes décisions stratégiques. Vous traduisez des ensembles de données complexes dans des recommandations pratiques pour améliorer la notoriété de notre marque et stimuler nos ventes.
  • Création de rapports visuels accrocheurs dans Power BI à propos des machines vendues, les parts de marché, la prise de commande, le modèle et la business unit.
  • Analyse et révision annuelle du degré de couverture de nos commerciaux afin de déterminer quelles régions sont les mieux desservies. Mise à jour de ces données dans nos systèmes ERP et CRM.
  • Mise à jour de l’ensemble des dasboards sales/marketing dans notre CRM (Salesforce) et créez des nouveaux tableaux de bord si nécessaire.
  • Réalisation mensuelle de dashboards clairs concernant l’ensemble de nos actions de marketing digitales et vous formulez des recommandations pour optimiser ces campagnes.
  • Vous allez plus loin que les analyses marketing conventionnelles car vous créez des nouvelles ‘expériences client’. Ensuite, vous implémentez vos créations par le biais de Marketing Cloud Salesforce.
  • En tant que coordinateur du programme ‘Marketing & Sales Excellence’ vous travaillez avec les départements concernés afin d’atteindre les objectifs et assurer le suivi des actions.
  • Organisation et préparation des enquêtes de satisfaction client. Analyse des résultats et facilitation des initiatives d’amélioration de la satisfaction client.

Profiel kandidaat

Vous voulez un job dynamique dans une culture d’entreprise informelle. Vous êtes extrêmement analytique et bon communicateur. Votre œil aiguisé du détail et votre capacité de détecter des modèles/tendances dans un ensemble complexe de données, vous permettent d’implémenter vos stratégies marketing out-of-the box.

Vos Compétences

  • Diplôme de bachelor ou master en marketing ou une filière connexe.
  • Niveau de compétence avancé en Excel (Power Querry/vba), en Power BI (DAX) et en rapportage graphique/visuel.
  • De l’expérience avec la conduite d’analyses de marché et de la concurrence.
  • Très grande capacité analytique et de l’expérience avec des outils d’analyse de données.
  • D’excellentes capacités de communication et de présentation.
  • Bon bilingue néerlandais/français (écrit et parlé) et une très bonne maîtrise de l’anglais.
  • Minimum 3 ans d’expérience dans une fonction similaire.
  • De l’expérience avec Marketing Cloud et Salesforce Sales Cloud (data model) est un atout).
  • Orienté résultats : atteindre des résultats mesurables.
  • Suivre les dernières tendances dans le domaine du marketing, surtout l’analyse et le rapportage.
  • Réflexion out-of-the box et proposition de solutions iinnovantes.
  • Sens du détail et rigueur.
  • Orienté client et solutions.
  • Flexibilité.
  • Utilisation fluide des outils Office 365.

Geboden wordt

  • Un contrat à durée déterminée avec un salaire et des avantages extralégaux comme des chèques-repas, assurances (groupe, invalidité, hospitalisation), voiture,laptop, smartphone et un Flex Income Plan.
  • Un job chez le concessionnaire exclusif de machines Caterpillar.
  • Des jours de télétravail.
  • Bon équilibre entre vie privée et professionnelle = Happiness @ Work.
  • Une bonne ambiance de travail et des collègues sur lesquels on peut compter.
  • Formations.
  • Contacts internationaux au sein de Caterpillar et du Monnoyeur Group.
