Title: Young Graduate Functional Data Analysis Consultant (fluent in French/ Dutch)
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Are you willing to kickstart your career at Orange Business Digital Services? By attending our 6-month Cloud & Data Academy – you will learn soft and hard skills along with the concepts underlying the leading technologies on the market in these areas of expertise. You will get solid foundations by working on real-world examples and you will be learning from industry experts alongside other young graduates. At the end of the academy, you are expected to present a global use case in front of a jury of subject matter experts and managers. After which you will join Orange Business Digital Services, as part of a multi-functional team where everyone contributes and shares their knowledge and expertise to achieve common goals.




At Orange Business Digital Services, we distinguish ourselves by the quality of our projects, the efficiency of our agile approach and the satisfaction of our clients, by fostering innovation and knowledge sharing. We are all about exploring fresh and smart ideas, learning from our experiences and mistakes, and thinking outside the box to push industries' boundaries, through the power of people. You will be part of a multi-functional team where everyone contributes and shares their knowledge and expertise to achieve common goals.







What you can expect as a Junior Data Consultant:




Supervised and coached by senior consultants, you will be placed in an ideal position to develop your skills, pass several certifications, and become one of our data specialists.




Once trained, as part of a project team, you will contribute to the delivery of valuable business insights, by putting into action all the skills you acquired.




Our famous Orange Business data projects:




Paradigm.BRUSSELS: Building a data platform (Snowflake, DBT, Mulesoft) for the Brussels Region to improve citizens' daily life and embrace tomorrow's city challenges.
Pharma company: Using public genetics data (Snowflake, microservices, Azure) in research for drugs development.
Metal industry company: Building a data analytics platform, centralizing manufacturing data in near real time (Azure Databricks, Azure Datafactory, Power BI)
Cosmetic company: Using NLP techniques to extract information from unstructured clinical study documents (Python, Google Vertex AI, Prodigy).
· And many more...




As an ideal candidate you have:




Bachelor or master's degree in IT, engineering, or a related technical field
Strong interest in IT and Data
Eager to learn new skills & ready to be trained
You are fluent in English, and either Dutch or French




It is not a requirement, but other preferred qualifications would be:




Knowledge of a programming language
Comprehension of SQL principles
Experience with a cloud provider (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Experience with a visualization tool (Tableau, PowerBI, …)
Internship, personal projects, or a 1st experience in IT




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:




Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.

Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.

With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.




Show more

Title: Job | Procurement Data & Business Analyst | Bruxelles
Description:
Description

Nous cherchons à recruter un Procurement Data & Business Analyst, le rôle est essentiel pour supporter le processus de transformation vers une organisation efficace des achats. Dans un premier temps le rôle consistera principalement à redéfinir les différent requirements au niveau de toutes les dimensions du reporting Procurement et de développer des formats, visuels et dashboards adéquat. Il nécessitera une approche Procurement best practice, user centric et un focus sur le data quality. Ensuite le rôle consistera à analyser les data et de proposer et de mener des projets de data cleansing ou d’améliorations au niveau des processus d’achat (inclus le P2P).

En tant que Procurement Data & Business Analyst, vous reportez au Procurement Data & Systems Manager.

Votre job en deux mots


Vous faites des analyses sur base de multiples données, et système afin d’en sortir des reporting et des conclusions visant à améliorer les processus.
Vous améliorez et automatisez les reporting tant pour le propre département que pour nos stakeholders : dashboards, visuels, Powerpoint, standardisés, attrayant et user centric.
Vous identifiez, proposez et conduisez l'amélioration continue des processus Procurement afin de supporter des opérations hautement efficaces.
Vous identifiez les nécessités de data quality improvement, vous proposer des approche/action concrètes et vous exécutez le data cleansing dans les délais convenus (critique au niveau du succès du projet Ariba et du futur projet S4HANA) Vous êtes responsable de développer des analyses détaillées pour permettre au Management de prendre des décisions stratégiques adéquates : analyse de coûts, analyse de risques, KPIs,…
Vous lancez des activités de contrôle, tel que le contrôle mensuels au niveau de l’efficacité des nouveaux processus et au niveau de la data quality.
Vous veillez à ce que toutes vos actions aident à atteindre les buts et les objectifs Procurement.
Vous êtes également un support opérationnel au sein de l’équipe Data & Systems et vous prenez à cœur certaines tâches quotidiennes (ou en tant que back up) p.ex. au niveau des encodages ou des mise à jour à faire, au niveau du reporting de certains projets, , au niveau de services support aux utilisateurs de nos outils…
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration et établissez de solides relations de travail avec divers stakeholders, notamment les départements internes, les partenaires externes, Accounting et IT.



Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare

Chez nous, vous pouvez vous distinguer et révéler le meilleur de vous-même si vous répondez aux critères suivants :


D’une bonne compréhension End -to -End et expérience pratique au niveau des processus Procurement et du processus P2P en particulier.
De motivation pour réaliser des améliorations continues et poursuivre l'efficacité grâce à l'automatisation des processus, la digitalisation et l'utilisation de l'IA.
D’une connaissance au niveau d’ SAP (MM) et/ou Ariba ou d’outils Procurement similaires et vous avez une forte envie d’approfondir ces connaissances.
D’une excellente maitrise MS Suite (Excel/PowerPoint) – vous aimez jouez avec des formules, lookups, pivots tables …d’une expérience en spend & data (business) analytics. D’une connaissance en outils de reporting comme Qlik Sense ou similaire, de compétences de synthèse et de communication – vous savez comment rendre vos conclusions explicit, clair ou visuel.
D’un intérêt pour de nouveaux outils et l’utilisation d'IA au sein de Procurement.
D’un sens du détail et vous contrôlez et analysez proactivement les données et les tendances des KPI avant de les partager. D’une fluidité au niveau linguistique - Bilingue FR-NL et une bonne connaissance de l'anglais.



Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :


Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius.
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé.
Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier.

  • Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier.

Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
This is Worldline




Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.







The Opportunity




Within Wordline’s Merchant Services Business Line, the Small and Medium Business Division (SMB) targets Mass and Mid market merchants across key European markets. The Growth & Performance team is a central SMB team overseeing the production and monitoring of key growth metrics for the division. The team ensures the regular production of performance data, supports the deployment of the relevant analytical tools and engages with the SMB regions to design and monitor action plans to boost growth. Within the Growth Performance team the Performance Analyst will be responsible of defining, collecting and processing relevant KPI in order to support decision making within SMB management. You'll also be solicitated for more ad hoc analyses or local deep dives.







Day-to-Day Responsibilities​




To support implementing and monitoring relevant KPIs across the full sales cycle for each and in the full RB scope
Sponsor and support the deployment within RB of a proper performance monitoring framework
Plan, drive and implement initiatives related to improving sales efficiency across the RB scope
Deliver ad hoc analysis to better understand our business and support decision making.
Make sure our insights are accurate
You like to experience with data and powerbi reporting




Who Are We Looking For




We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:




You have preferably a Bachelor degree in a relevant field, or equivalent by experience
1-3 years working experience in finance or consulting
Powerbi Experience is considered a plus
Fluency in English language
Experience of international organisations is preferred
You see yourself as a true doer driving change and being able to work in an ever changing environment – The concrete business outcomes from your work is what motivates you.
You have an analytical mindset – You are curious and want to know more.
You act like an entrepreneur and can quickly identify a business’ processes and value drivers.
You are data driven and turn that data in to insights and true value in our future growth.
You see yourself as a team player – being used to collaboration across borders and cultures as well as working with several stakeholders and workstreams simultaneously




Perks & Benefits




At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:




Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career










Shape the evolution.




We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.




Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com




We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Job | Procurement Data & Business Analyst | Brussel
Description:
Omschrijving

We zijn op zoek naar een Procurement Data & Business Analyst, wiens rol essentieel is ter ondersteuning van het hervormingsproces naar een efficiënte aankooporganisatie. In een eerste fase bestaat de rol er in hoofdzaak een nieuwe omschrijving te geven aan de diverse vereisten in verband met alle dimensies van de reporting inzake Procurement en in de ontwikkeling van de aangepaste formaten, visuals en dashboards. Daarvoor zal er een benadering van Procurement nodig zijn op basis van best practices, die user centric is en de focus legt op de data quality. Voorts zal de rol inhouden dat je de data gaat analyseren en voorstellen gaat doen en zorgt voor de concrete uitvoering van projecten inzake data cleansing of verbeteringen van het aankoopproces (incl. P2P).

Als Procurement Data & Business Analyst rapporteer je aan de Procurement Data & Systems Manager.

De job in een notendop


Je maakt analyses op basis van tal van gegevens, databases en systemen om er de reportings en conclusies uit te halen die de processen moeten verbeteren.
Je verbetert en automatiseert de reportings zowel voor de eigen afdeling als voor onze stakeholders: dashboards, visuals, Powerpoints, die gestandaardiseerd, aantrekkelijk en user centric zijn.
Je identificeert, je suggereert en je stuurt de continue verbetering aan van de Procurement-processen om hoogst efficiënte activiteiten te ondersteunen.
Je identificeert de noodzakelijke componenten inzake data quality improvement, je doet voorstellen op het vlak van concrete benaderingen/acties en je voert de data cleansing uit binnen de overeengekomen termijnen (kritisch voor het welslagen van het project Ariba en van het toekomstig project S4HANA). Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het uitwerken van gedetailleerde analyses om het Management in staat te stellen afdoende strategische beslissingen te nemen: kostenanalyse, risicoanalyse, KPI’s enz.
Je brengt controleactiviteiten op gang, zoals de maandelijkse controle op de efficiëntie van de nieuwe processen en op de data quality.
Je ziet erop toe dat al je acties bijdragen tot het halen van de doelstellingen van Procurement.
Je biedt eveneens operationele ondersteuning binnen het team Data & Systems en je neemt bepaalde dagelijkse taken op jou (of als back-up) bv. in verband met de invoer of de updates die moeten gebeuren, de reporting rond bepaalde projecten enz., de ondersteunende diensten voor de gebruikers van onze tools enz.
Je werkt nauw samen en onderhoudt degelijke werkrelaties met diverse stakeholders, waaronder interne afdelingen, externe partners, Accounting en IT.



Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel één worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:


Een goed end-to-endbegrip van en praktische ervaring met de Procurement-procedures en met het P2P-pcoces in het bijzonder.
Motivatie voor het voortdurend verbeteren en voortzetten van de efficiëntie dankzij de automatisering van de processen, de digitalisering en het gebruik van AI.
Kennis van SAP (MM) en/of Ariba of van vergelijkbare Procurement-tools en een grote bereidheid om die kennis uit te diepen.
Uitstekende beheersing van MS Suite (Excel/PowerPoint) – je speelt graag met formules, lookups, pivots tables …ervaring met spend & data (business) analytics. Kennis inzake reportingtools zoals Qlik Sense e.d., synthese- en communicatievaardigheden – je weet hoe je je besluiten expliciet, helder en visueel moet maken.
Belangstelling voor nieuwe tools en het gebruik van AI binnen Procurement.
Je hebt zin voor detail en je controleert en analyseert proactief de gegevens en de trends van de KPI alvorens ze te delen. Vlot taalgebruik - Tweetalig NL-FR en een goede kennis van het Engels.



Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:


Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carrièrekansen in de hele Belfius-groep.
Een goede werk-privé balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen.
Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier.

Show more

Title: Banking - Data Engineer - Informatica PowerCenter
Description:
As the leader for today’s leaders, Capgemini brings deep industry experience, innovative service offerings and next-generation global delivery.

Work and learn in a profoundly dynamic environment. Work side by side with your colleagues while partnering with the client. Play with hot technologies.

Capgemini offers end to end IT solutions. We work in Project Mode for our clients in all Industries. Banks, Insurance companies from small to large projects.

Capgemini provides talent with a challenging international environment and a captivating perspective on their future. At Capgemini you can gain various expertise and build a large international network, you will have more than 360.000 colleagues from all over the world.

If you believe that honesty, boldness, modesty, trust, freedom, team spirit and fun are important company values we have a match. Check it out, here you find our 7 core values.

Location Belgiumpart-time on-site, part-time home working, remote is not an option.

Scope


The Data Engineer prepares the technical analysis and design of the solution as defined by Architects; so that the configuration or development can be implemented by the same Analyst or a Developer.



Communication and personality


English: must have
and at least one local language (French or Dutch) : must have
Strong consulting experience and skills: good written and verbal communication, problem-solving mindset, able to work independently, dynamic, etc.
Customer oriented.
Confident and not afraid of a new challenge.
Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player always ready to share, train or provide support to others.
Flexible, accurate & control minded.
Ability to turn technical topics into easy-to-understand communication.



Skills And Knowledge


In-depth mastery of Informatica-PowerCenter
Profound knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL
Experience with Sybase, SQLl developer, GIT, control-M , Rally and Powerdesigner
Good mastery of performance tuning of ETL jobs
Data modelling (Logical and Physical)
Working knowledge of Informatica business usage modules:
business glossaries, terms, and policies to maintain standardized definitions of data assets in the organization.
data discovery to find the content, quality, and structure of data sources, and monitor data quality trends.
data integration logic and collaborate on projects to accelerate project delivery.
manage rules to verify data conformance to business policies.
review and resolve data quality issues to find and fix data quality issues in the organization.

Nice to have


Knowledge and having worked with Agile
Experience in Banking, Credit Risk environments



What motivates you?

Would you like to grow into the role of expert or would you rather develop your managerial skills? At Capgemini, you are at the helm and you have the freedom to direct your career yourself. So tell us your ambitions, we are happy to help you with that. You have access to more than hundreds of training and education through the All you can train program, our Capgemini Academy and the Capgemini University at our unique location near Paris.

What we offer you?

A dynamic environment with like-minded professionals and challenging projects for large clients at home and abroad. That is what you can expect when you start working with us.

We like to work together to achieve good results, but we think a pleasant working atmosphere is just as important. We regularly share knowledge with each other and regularly go out for a nice Friday afternoon drink. What else can you expect?


Immediately a permanent contract with a suitable salary
A company car and fuel card
An expense allowance and a meal allowance
32 vacation days
A non-contributory pension and hospitalization insurance
A laptop, SIM card and connectivity fee to work in a hybrid work setting.



Do you like to give our clients the insight they need? And will you become the driving force behind their (digital) transformation? Then we look forward to receiving your application. You can read more about Capgemini and our people on "Working at Capgemini".

By applying to this vacancy, you agree with a background and/or reference check if applicable.

Have a great day!

Title: Functional Analyst
Description:
Functional Analyst - FREELANCE - BRUSSELS - HYBRID




About the Role:

As a Functional Analyst - Salesforce Integration, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the

smooth operation and optimization of our Salesforce applications. You will be responsible for

incident and problem management, operational support, functional analysis for roadmap

projects, and maintaining strong collaborations with technical teams.




Key Responsibilities:

• Incident and Problem Management for MIMOSA and FIONA applications.

• Provide operational support to users.

• Conduct functional analysis for roadmap projects, including requirement gathering,

design, build support, testing, deployment, and business change support.

• Perform functional analysis within the framework of evolutionary maintenance.

• Collaborate closely with technical analysts and SAP PM developers.

• Organize and execute tests related to finance, purchasing, invoicing, cost accounting,

and logistics aspects.

• Organize and execute tests related to integrations between Salesforce and other

platforms (SAP, Sharepoint, GIS systems, etc.).

• Conduct quality control of Salesforce/SAP data and propose improvements to source

systems.

• Manage business requests related to projects and evolutionary maintenance.




Qualifications and Experience:

• Proven experience as a Functional Analyst or in a similar role.

• Strong understanding of Salesforce and its applications.

• Knowledge of SAP PM and other relevant systems.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.




Please apply to find out further information.

Title: Data Engineer ( Azure / Fabric / Databricks )
Description:
As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.




We are looking for a Data Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems
Ensure data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a set of business requirements and constraints
Create and design data models
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design




Knowledge & Experience

One more more leading Data platforms: Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform and it's infra and CI/CD context
Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL database, Azure Devops, Azure Analysis Services, ...
Databricks
Snowflake, Snowpipe, Snowflake Native Apps, ...
Keen understanding of Data Modeling methodologies (Kimball, Data Vault 2.0)
Knowledge of Lakehouse principles and medallion architecture
Expert knowledge of SQL and T-SQL or DBT
Professional working proficiency in Dutch & English




Relevant certificates

DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
Snowpro core/advanced
Databricks Lakehouse Professional




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment—problem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.




For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Show more
HTML:
As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.


We are looking for a Data Engineer to help our clients in their digital transformations.


Key tasks & activities

  • Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems
  • Ensure data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a set of business requirements and constraints
  • Create and design data models
  • Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design


Knowledge & Experience

  • One more more leading Data platforms: Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform and it's infra and CI/CD context
  • Microsoft Fabric, Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure SQL database, Azure Devops, Azure Analysis Services, ...
  • Databricks
  • Snowflake, Snowpipe, Snowflake Native Apps, ...
  • Keen understanding of Data Modeling methodologies (Kimball, Data Vault 2.0)
  • Knowledge of Lakehouse principles and medallion architecture
  • Expert knowledge of SQL and T-SQL or DBT
  • Professional working proficiency in Dutch & English


Relevant certificates

  • DP-203: Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure
  • Snowpro core/advanced
  • Databricks Lakehouse Professional


#GetTheFutureYouWant


At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment—problem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.


In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

  • A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
  • Meal & eco vouchers
  • Group & health insurance
  • Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
  • 32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
  • Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies


Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.


For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Title: Data engineer - Energy and Utilities
Description:
Position Description

Are you the Data Engineer who knows how to make a difference by preparing and transforming data from raw data into actionable data that helps create business value? Do you want to contribute to the energy transition with innovative data solutions and help our clients become data-driven organizations?

Your role in our team

At the heart of our efforts to accelerate the energy transition, you will play a vital role as a Data Engineer. Together with customers, colleagues and partners, you work on developing and implementing solutions that are not only technologically advanced, but also smart and sustainable. You do this by working closely together in a multidisciplinary team of Data Scientists, Engineers and Architects. You will contribute to building and maintaining robust data platforms and play a key role in the architectural design of new projects.

Together, you translate the latest trends in both the IT and energy industries into practical and innovative solutions that help our customers achieve their sustainability goals. Your contribution will foster a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration, aimed at achieving the best possible results in our mission to support the energy transition with smart data-driven solutions.

How You Strengthen Our Team

You have a passion for data and innovation and are well-versed in the latest developments in your field. Data is your driving force. You are naturally curious, proactive and easily win others over to your ideas. In addition, you are active in sharing and developing your knowledge within your field. You have an Agile mindset and experience of working in an Agile environment.

Furthermore, we ask:

At least 5Y experience as a Data Engineer with a track record of designing, implementing, and optimizing data solutions.

Strong experience with AWS services such as S3, Athena, Glue, and Redshift, and effective experience in utilizing Databricks, preferably on AWS, for data processing and analytics.

Programming skills in Python, Spark, SQL, or another data engineering language, with the ability to develop and maintain complex data workflows and transformations.

Experience with data processing technologies and frameworks, along with a strong understanding of data architecture principles and best practices.

Knowledge of Agile processes such as Scrum or Kanban, with the ability to work collaboratively within a cross-functional team environment.

Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently to deliver high-quality data solutions.

Is a PLUS :

Experience in utilities market / Metering & allocation data management

Knowledge of technical systems like SAP ISU

Familiar with financial closing reports

Native Dutch or French with good communication in English

Education : Bachelor or master degree with a focus on Information Technology, or equivalent

A pre-employment screening is part of the application process

Why CGI?

CGI is one of the world's largest IT consultancy companies. Our people keep Belgium running. Government institutions, banks, infrastructure organization's, energy and utilities, manufacturing and life sciences companies are CGI's clients . We work on interesting projects that touch the everyday lives of millions of people. We have a regional presence, reinforced with global domain expertise, our ecosystem and colleagues spread across the globe.

We are proud of the impactful projects we make a success together with our colleagues.

At CGI, we value diversity and inclusion as it not only promotes collaboration, but also often leads to better results. We look forward to your contribution to our team!

Working in small self-managing teams consisting of experts in your field.


Directing your own career with the space to keep developing yourself.
You work with the latest technologies.
An excellent salary and attractive fringe benefits
An immediate permanent contract
And the opportunity to become a CGI shareholder


Join our team of experts and apply now!

If you are passionate about application onboarding, thrive in a collaborative setting, and are ready to make a strategic impact, apply now and be a part of our team. Your journey towards shaping seamless application integrations starts here!

Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen, Director Consultant Services , Energy and Utilities, , bart.jansen@cgi.com.

For more information about the application procedure, please contact recruiter Fabienne Philips fabienne.philips@cgi.com

We do not collaborate with external recruitment agencies. Therefore, unsolicited acquisition is not appreciated.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let’s turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you’ll reach your full potential because…

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You’ll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You’ll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You’ll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team—one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Business Analyst with AI knowledge
Description:
For one of our clients at the European Commission, we are currently looking for a Business Analyst with AI/ML expertise.




Main responsibilities




Collect business requirement and analyse advanced AI solutions or identify and assess relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution
Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
Produce data models according to specific problems statements.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…)
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.
Interact with data stewards and other IT stakeholders to define the data rules;
Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity;
Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance;
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis;
Participate in the design of the IT architecture for solutions in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts;
Analyse data architecture for consistency, completeness, accuracy and reasonableness;
Contribute for the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and derive the IT requirements.




Requirements:




Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies.
Experience in the field of corpus-based linguistics.
Experience with alignment models and classification methods.
Experience with data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes.
Good knowledge of analysis/modelling tools and techniques (use case diagram, state diagram, entity relationship model, interaction diagrams etc.).
Good knowledge of BPMN or UML or other with equivalent value.
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing.
Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL.
Good knowledge of business intelligence tools (Tableau, Qlik, SAS, SAP, GoodData…)
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (SAS, Talend Open Studio…)
Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL)
Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores.

Title: Young Graduate Functional Data Analysis Consultant (fluent in French/ Dutch)
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Are you willing to kickstart your career at Orange Business Digital Services? By attending our 6-month Cloud & Data Academy – you will learn soft and hard skills along with the concepts underlying the leading technologies on the market in these areas of expertise. You will get solid foundations by working on real-world examples and you will be learning from industry experts alongside other young graduates. At the end of the academy, you are expected to present a global use case in front of a jury of subject matter experts and managers. After which you will join Orange Business Digital Services, as part of a multi-functional team where everyone contributes and shares their knowledge and expertise to achieve common goals.




At Orange Business Digital Services, we distinguish ourselves by the quality of our projects, the efficiency of our agile approach and the satisfaction of our clients, by fostering innovation and knowledge sharing. We are all about exploring fresh and smart ideas, learning from our experiences and mistakes, and thinking outside the box to push industries' boundaries, through the power of people. You will be part of a multi-functional team where everyone contributes and shares their knowledge and expertise to achieve common goals.







What you can expect as a Junior Data Consultant:




Supervised and coached by senior consultants, you will be placed in an ideal position to develop your skills, pass several certifications, and become one of our data specialists.




Once trained, as part of a project team, you will contribute to the delivery of valuable business insights, by putting into action all the skills you acquired.




Our famous Orange Business data projects:




Paradigm.BRUSSELS: Building a data platform (Snowflake, DBT, Mulesoft) for the Brussels Region to improve citizens' daily life and embrace tomorrow's city challenges.
Pharma company: Using public genetics data (Snowflake, microservices, Azure) in research for drugs development.
Metal industry company: Building a data analytics platform, centralizing manufacturing data in near real time (Azure Databricks, Azure Datafactory, Power BI)
Cosmetic company: Using NLP techniques to extract information from unstructured clinical study documents (Python, Google Vertex AI, Prodigy).
· And many more...




As an ideal candidate you have:




Bachelor or master's degree in IT, engineering, or a related technical field
Strong interest in IT and Data
Eager to learn new skills & ready to be trained
You are fluent in English, and either Dutch or French




It is not a requirement, but other preferred qualifications would be:




Knowledge of a programming language
Comprehension of SQL principles
Experience with a cloud provider (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Experience with a visualization tool (Tableau, PowerBI, …)
Internship, personal projects, or a 1st experience in IT




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:




Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.

Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.

With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.




Show more

Description:

They are looking for a candidate who has an analytical mindset with experience in conducting both quantitative and qualitative research to drive strategic decisions. experience and background with workplace analytics, data science and
software engineering background

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Production, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la récolte, l'analyse et l'interprétation des données afin d’élaborer des stratégies d'amélioration pour le site de Production des Acacias.

Responsabilités


Contribuer activement à différentes initiatives du site en établissant les indicateurs clés pour le suivi efficace du projet
Récupérer puis traiter des données issues de sources variées telles que ERP, PLM, MES, LES, ou directement des équipements
Présenter les résultats analysés en utilisant des outils de visualisation de données pour faciliter la compréhension
Comprendre les problématiques métier et les traduire de manière analytique
Collaborer avec le département informatique pour automatiser le traitement des flux de données.
Garder une veille technologique active sur les nouveaux outils et méthodes d'analyse de données


Profil


Ingénieur HES, EPF ou équivalent
Connaissance des outils de traitement et d’analyse de données (Python, Dataiku, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données
Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie
Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace
Dynamisme, flexibilité et esprit d'équipe


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Alohi SA, headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, brings together a highly competent team that focuses on merging state-of-the-art technologies with compelling user experience to simplify and enhance life for companies and people worldwide. The company provides Sign.Plus (a legally binding electronic signature), Fax.Plus (online faxing), and Scan.Plus (Ai-powered mobile scanner) to over 3,000,000 customers worldwide.

At Alohi, we began our journey with an initial seed investment from Fongit "Fondation Genevoise pour l'Innovation Technologique" which is backed by the state of Geneva. But instead of relying on external funding to fuel our growth, we've chosen to bootstrap our way to success. This approach has allowed us to prioritize our customers and build products that truly meet their needs, without being beholden to outside investors. By remaining financially independent, we've been able to maintain our autonomy and agility, which have been key factors in our ability to innovate and stay ahead of the curve.

Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. As a Data Analyst at Alohi, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. You will craft effective intelligent benchmarks, understand performance, care about data quality, enable automation and create visualizations and stories that help drive our business.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize key business questions and objectives
Design and implement data collection systems and processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of data
Work with SQL and other data tools to extract, clean, and analyze data from various sources
Clean, transform, and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis
Analyze complex datasets using statistical techniques and data visualization tools
Identify patterns, trends, and correlations in the data to derive meaningful insights
Integrate and utilize AI tools like OpenAI API to develop and implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for data-driven insights
Assist in designing experiments (A/B tests) and analyze the results to inform product development and marketing strategies
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
Monitor and evaluate the performance of data-driven initiatives and provide recommendations for improvements
Support ad-hoc data analysis requests from different departments to inform strategic decisions



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science
Minimum 4 years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role
Proficient in SQL and experience working with relational databases
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets
Experience with data visualization tools such as Metabase, Tableau and Power BI
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualizations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work within deadlines
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience using OpenAI API or similar AI tools, specifically with implementing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus
Experience with ETL processes and data integration is a plus
Show more
HTML:
Alohi SA, headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, brings together a highly competent team that focuses on merging state-of-the-art technologies with compelling user experience to simplify and enhance life for companies and people worldwide. The company provides Sign.Plus (a legally binding electronic signature), Fax.Plus (online faxing), and Scan.Plus (Ai-powered mobile scanner) to over 3,000,000 customers worldwide.

At Alohi, we began our journey with an initial seed investment from Fongit "Fondation Genevoise pour l'Innovation Technologique" which is backed by the state of Geneva. But instead of relying on external funding to fuel our growth, we've chosen to bootstrap our way to success. This approach has allowed us to prioritize our customers and build products that truly meet their needs, without being beholden to outside investors. By remaining financially independent, we've been able to maintain our autonomy and agility, which have been key factors in our ability to innovate and stay ahead of the curve.

Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. As a Data Analyst at Alohi, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. You will craft effective intelligent benchmarks, understand performance, care about data quality, enable automation and create visualizations and stories that help drive our business.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize key business questions and objectives
  • Design and implement data collection systems and processes to ensure accuracy and completeness of data
  • Work with SQL and other data tools to extract, clean, and analyze data from various sources
  • Clean, transform, and preprocess data to prepare it for analysis
  • Analyze complex datasets using statistical techniques and data visualization tools
  • Identify patterns, trends, and correlations in the data to derive meaningful insights
  • Integrate and utilize AI tools like OpenAI API to develop and implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) for data-driven insights
  • Assist in designing experiments (A/B tests) and analyze the results to inform product development and marketing strategies
  • Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders
  • Monitor and evaluate the performance of data-driven initiatives and provide recommendations for improvements
  • Support ad-hoc data analysis requests from different departments to inform strategic decisions


Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science
  • Minimum 4 years experience as a Data Analyst or similar role
  • Proficient in SQL and experience working with relational databases
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Metabase, Tableau and Power BI
  • Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualizations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python
  • Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to deliver high-quality work within deadlines
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Experience using OpenAI API or similar AI tools, specifically with implementing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
  • Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus
  • Experience with ETL processes and data integration is a plus

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Experis ist der weltweit führende Anbieter von professionellen Personalressourcen und projektbasierten Workforce-Lösungen.

Im Auftrag eines unserer Kunden, Transport- und Logistikunternehmen, suchen wir einen Data Analyst.

Aufgabengebiet

Weiterentwickeln der Datenarchitektur basierend auf den Azure Analytics Services
Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines



Anforderungsprofil

Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Kontakt: Alba Jansa

Whatsapp Business: +41 76 811 63 99

T: +41 61 282 22 13

Show more

Title: HR Data Analyst Intern
Description:
SHL Medical AG is a world-leading solution provider in the design, development, and manufacturing of advanced drug delivery systems with more than 5000 employees worldwide. Our customers include top pharmaceutical and biotech companies from around the globe that require innovative devices such as auto injectors or pen injectors to effectively deliver their drugs. Headquartered in Switzerland since late 2018.




Job Overview




The HR Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and reporting on key HR metrics (specifically Peakon results) to support data-driven decision-making within the organization. This role involves working closely with the HR team and other departments to ensure that data is accurately captured, processed, and translated into actionable insights that can improve workforce planning, employee performance, and overall organizational effectiveness.




Main Responsibilities




HR Data Collection & Management:

Gather and maintain HR data from various sources, including Peakon EES, HRIS (Human Resource Information Systems), and other relevant databases.




Data Analysis:

Analyse HR data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to employee demographics, engagement, and other HR-related metrics.




Reporting & Visualization:

Prepare and present detailed reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate key findings to HR leadership and other stakeholders.
Generate regular and ad-hoc reports on metrics and relevant KPIs.




Stakeholder Collaboration:

Work closely with HR and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide insights that support strategic decision-making.
Assist in developing HR strategies and policies based on data-driven insights.

Compliance & Data Security:

Ensure that the assigned HR data practices comply with legal and regulatory requirements, including data protection and privacy laws.
Maintain confidentiality and security of sensitive HR data.




Professional Experience & Specific Skills

Must have:

Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, or R.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and predictive modeling.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.




Desirable (nice to have):

Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with HRIS platforms (e.g., Workday, SAP SuccessFactors) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).







Relevant Qualification/education and training




Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Data Science, Business Administration, Statistics, or a related field. A Master's degree or HR certification is a plus.
Experience with advanced data analytics.
Knowledge of HR practices and principles.
Familiarity with data privacy regulations such as GDPR or CCPA.







Language skills

Mandatory (Must):

Fluent English




Interested in joining SHL Medical and in supporting us with your expertise and personality? Then we look forward to receiving your application including your CV, motivation letter, and all other relevant documents via the Easy Apply button or directly to RecruitCH@shl-group.com.




For more information on SHL Medical, please visit: linkedin.com/company/shlmedical/life




Is this not quite what you are looking for? Further interesting career opportunities can be found on: shl-medical.com/careers




Please note: For this position, we do not consider applications from recruitment agencies.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist for one of our clients in the Lucerne area.




In this position, you'll be responsible for developing the BI system, generating reports and data visualizations for internal users, gathering the needs of different departments and managers, identifying necessary data and reports, and creating and updating reports and evaluations to aid decision-making. You’ll collaborate closely with business experts to achieve these tasks.




If you have a degree in business informatics, complemented by experience with Power BI and SQL, and excellent knowledge of German and English, this is the right opportunity for you!




Experience in Qlik is an advantage.




If you want to hear more about this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Recherche & Développement, nous recherchons un Business/Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera d’analyser des données de la division afin de permettre le pilotage des activités au travers d’indicateurs.

Responsabilités


Garantir la maîtrise de la structure des données (contenant et contenu)
Animer le réseau Gouvernance des Données de la division et promouvoir la démarche
Définir les règles d'utilisation, de codification et de maintenance de la structure des données de base
Rédiger et communiquer les règles définies
Piloter et planifier des actions de nettoyage et/ou de maintenance en collaboration avec le réseau Gouvernance des Données
Assurer et consolider une surveillance de l'application des règles au travers d'indicateurs
Assurer la cohérence de processus avec les autres divisions et l'Informatique


Profil


Formation universitaire ou Ingénieur EPF
Expérience confirmée dans la gestion de données (ERP, PLM, Data Mining)
Maitrise des outils Office et de SAP, Windchill, Tableau constitue un atout
Expérience confirmée dans les méthodes agiles (rôle de Product Owner)
Personne dynamique, autonome, rigoureuse, ouverte d'esprit, apte à travailler en équipe et ayant le sens de la communication et du leadership


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d'excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificat et diplômes).
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - (F/H/X)
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting est une société indépendante de conseil et de technologies au service des entreprises. Avec plus de 1000 clients dans le monde, nous déployons des solutions pour les plus grands projets depuis plus d'une décennie - tout ceci est rendu possible par une équipe internationale de 7 600 talents répartis sur les 5 continents et dans plus de 60 pays. Nos solutions sont axées sur quatre domaines d'activité différents : Les systèmes d'information et le digital, la télécommunication, les sciences de la vie et l'ingénierie. Nous cherchons à créer et à développer une communauté de talents où tous les membres de notre équipe peuvent réaliser leur plein potentiel. Amaris est votre « stepping stone » pour traverser les rivières du changement, pour relever les défis et pour réaliser tous vos projets avec succès.

Chez Amaris, Nous Avons à Cœur D'offrir à Nos Candidats La Meilleure Expérience De Recrutement Possible. Nous Cherchons à Mieux Connaître Et Comprendre Nos Candidats, à Les Challenger Et à Leur Faire Part De Nos Impressions Le Plus Rapidement Possible. Voici à Quoi Ressemble Notre Processus De Recrutement

Premier contact : Notre processus commence généralement par une brève conversation virtuelle/téléphonique pour en savoir plus sur vous ! L'objectif ? Apprendre à vous connaître, comprendre vos motivations et veiller à ce que nous vous proposions le poste qui vous correspond le mieux !

Entretiens (en moyenne, le nombre d'entretiens est de 3 – il peut toutefois varier en fonction du niveau d'ancienneté requis pour le poste). Au cours des entretiens, vous rencontrerez les membres de notre équipe : votre supérieur hiérarchique bien sûr, mais aussi d'autres personnes avec lesquelles vous serez amené à travailler. Ces entretiens nous permettront d'en apprendre davantage sur vous, votre expérience et vos compétences, mais aussi sur le poste et ce que l'on attendra de vous. Bien entendu, vous apprendrez également à connaître Amaris : notre culture, notre histoire, nos équipes et vos opportunités de carrière !

Étude de cas: En fonction du poste, vous serez peut-être appelé à passer un test. Il pourra s'agir d'un jeu de rôle, d'une évaluation technique, d'un scénario de résolution de problème, etc.

Comme vous le savez, chaque personne est différente et il en va de même pour chaque rôle dans une entreprise. C'est pourquoi nous devons nous adapter en conséquence, si bien que le processus peut parfois être quelque peu différent pour chacun. Cela dit, nous nous mettons toujours à la place du candidat pour lui offrir la meilleure expérience possible. Nous avons hâte de vous rencontrer !

Job Description

Nous recherchons un Data Analyst pour rejoindre nos équipes.

🔥Vos Responsabilités


Collecter, analyser et interpréter des données provenant de diverses sources internes et externes.
Développer et maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI).
Collaborer avec les départements clés (production, logistique, finance, etc.) pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et fournir des analyses pertinentes.
Identifier les tendances, les modèles et les opportunités d'amélioration continue au sein des processus de l'entreprise.
Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données pour prédire les performances futures et soutenir la prise de décision.
Assurer la qualité, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données utilisées pour les analyses.
Fournir des recommandations basées sur les analyses de données pour optimiser les processus et les stratégies de l'entreprise.
Utiliser des outils et des techniques de visualisation de données pour communiquer clairement les résultats des analyses.


🎯 Votre Profil


Diplôme en statistiques, informatique, analyse de données ou équivalent.
Expérience de minimum 2 ans dans un poste similaire.
Solides compétences en analyse de données et en résolution de problèmes.
Expérience avec des outils d'analyse de données et de visualisation (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Excellente capacité à interpréter et à présenter des données complexes de manière claire et concise.
Bonnes compétences en communication et en travail d'équipe.
Maitrise des langages de programmation pour l'analyse de données (Python, R) est un atout.
Connaissance des principes de gestion des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de qualité des données.


💡Notre Culture D'entreprise


Agilité : Évoluez dans un environnement flexible, dynamique et stimulant.
International : Bénéficiez de collaborations internationales et de nombreuses opportunités de mobilité.
Intrapreneuriat : Impliquez-vous dans des initiatives parallèles ou développez votre propre Business Unit.
Management à l'écoute : Recevez un accompagnement personnalisé tout au long de votre parcours professionnel.


Amaris Consulting s'engage en faveur de la diversité et de l'inclusion. Nous encourageons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées, indépendamment du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle, de la race, de l'origine ethnique, des croyances, de l'âge, de l'état matrimonial, du handicap ou de toute autre caractéristique.
Show more

  • Excellente capacité à interpréter et à présenter des données complexes de manière claire et concise.
  • Bonnes compétences en communication et en travail d'équipe.
  • Maitrise des langages de programmation pour l'analyse de données (Python, R) est un atout.

Title: Junior Payroll Data Analyst
Description:
Mercuria is one of the world’s leading independent energy and commodity groups. Our purpose is to connect markets and to advance the energy transition. We bring markets together to support the world’s energy needs of today by trading, structuring finance, and investing into strategic assets, whilst generating over $170 billion in turnover. We are committed to advancing the transition to a more sustainable, affordable and reliable energy system for tomorrow. We are well ahead of the pledge we made in 2021 that over half of our investment capital will go into sectors that are advancing the energy transition by 2025, to contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.




As a Junior Payroll Analyst for Mercuria Energy Trading, your primary role will be to assist in the collection, preparation, and provision of payroll information to our payroll team; focusing on finding ways to automate and optimize the process. You will work to ensure accuracy and confidentiality in all payroll data, while also providing exceptional payroll services and support. Your advanced analytics and data science skills will be relevant to enhance our processes and act as an agent of change.




Key Responsibilities:




Assist the payroll team with the timely collection and preparation of payroll variables on a monthly basis.
Verify the accuracy of payroll information by collecting, computing, and entering data into the payroll system.
Assist in preparing payroll reports for audits and management review.
Update payroll records by entering changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, deductions, job titles, and department/division transfers.
Respond to payroll queries by providing required information timely and accurately, while maintaining the confidentiality of payroll operations.
Liaise with human resources for new hires, terminations, and benefits updates.
Participate in relevant projects that require cross-departmental collaboration when required.
Utilize advanced analytics and numeric skills to improve payroll processes.
Apply business analysis capabilities to identify and implement process automation.
Engage in data science and coding tasks to support payroll and broader business functions.







Qualifications and Skills:




Bachelor’s Degree in a numerical field of studies;
Minimum 2 years of experience in a function where you are responsible for collecting variables, reconciling and analyzing data.
Strong numerical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel, with advanced analytics skills.
Proficiency in French and English. Additional language skills would be a plus.
Tech-savvy with a strong interest in data science and coding.
Strong drive for process enhancements and automation.

Show more

Title: Client Data Analyst (M/W)
Description:
A master in the Art of Fusion, respecting the tradition and creative vision of the 21st century, Swiss watchmaker Hublot places innovation at the heart of its growth strategy. Driven by a young spirit, resolutely looking to the future, Hublot's teams are constantly looking for innovative concepts, which is Hublot’s trademark. Beyond the development of major watchmaking complications, Hublot is associated with the biggest names in the world of sport, through collaborations with FIFA, UEFA, Kylian Mbappé, Pelé, Usain Bolt and many more. Hublot touches on many varied fields including music - with the famous virtuoso pianist Lang Lang as well as DJ Snake - and art with Daniel Arsham, Samuel Ross or Sang Bleu, among others.




As part of Hublot’s new global Client & Omnichannel Department, which oversees the brand’s client development, client data, client experience and omnichannel transformation, we are looking for a Senior Client Data Analyst to analyze our client data in order to provide concrete insights to the business, as well as oversee our client data and client data roadmap. The candidate should be passionate about big data and the omnichannel mindset, and an agent for change in the brand’s ongoing digital transformation. Come and join the team at our headquarters (HQ) in Nyon to play a key role in the development of our global Client Development & Client Data Division!




Client Data Analyst (M/W)




This role reports directly to the Client Development & Client Data Senior Manager and requires continuous cross-functional collaboration with our HQ Commercial, IT and Marketing Teams, as well as local Market teams.

The Senior Client Data Analyst will be the Hublot HQ “go to” contact for client data at the global level. His or her role will be to enrich the business’ knowledge about our prospects and clients by doing in-depth analyses using data from our multi-channel databases. These analyses will fuel strategic reflection on client behavior, our client segmentation, revenue drivers, loyalty actions as well as contribute to the continuous improvement of client journeys and experiences. He or she will also pilot the HQ Client Data roadmap by working closely with IT and Data teams from HQ, the LVMH Watch & Jewelry Division and LVMH Group.




Main responsibilities:

Client insights, analysis and reporting

Analysis of sell-out, warranty activation and client profile data in order to understand client purchasing behavior and the brand’s revenue drivers
Identify business needs and communicate underlying capabilities which need to be constructed
Consolidation and delivery of analysis results (reports, presentations etc.) including business impacts, conveying complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
Creation and implementation of automated reports for HQ and Market teams
Ad-hoc analysis on specific questions from Markets and the business (demographics, lead management, loyalty, etc.) including recommendations for action plans in collaboration with Commercial and Marketing teams using data visualization tools to support decision-making processes within the organization
Support and advise Client & Omnichannel department on creation and implementation of reports on clienteling, client experience and client journey initiatives to measure impact and ROI

Management of Client Data Projects

Contribute to the development of the Client data strategy and roadmap
Internal owner of prospect and client data: management of data quality, consistency, optimization of data flow across internal systems and improvement of data by monitoring of monthly KPIs. Implementation of corrective actions if necessary.
Monitor compliance with the HQ DPO, IT, Data and Legal department (GDPR, PIPL etc.)
Implement Client Data Governance policies, standards and procedures as defined by the Head of Data (IT)
Internal business owner of client segmentation, including its evolution
Implement roadmap in coordination with IT teams, Division and Group.
Support and coordinate client data IT transformation projects with the Division and LVMH Group
Propose AI project to boost sales and client loyalty business challenges.
Participation in Hublot Data governance committee
Stay informed about industry best practices and emerging trends in data analysis and stewardship and share with internal stakeholders




Profile:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics or Mathematics
Minimum 5 years’ experience as Client Data Analyst or exploitation specialist
Essential analytical competencies including datamining statistics
Expertise of Excel, CRM systems, data visualization tools (Power BI), data analytics languages and platforms (SQL, Dataiku)
Ability to manage technical cross-functional projects
Must embrace challenges, be comfortable with ambiguity and possesses a proactive, solution-oriented mindset
Problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Ability to interact smoothly with different departments and levels of hierarchy
Motivation and true willingness to work cross-functionally
Experience in luxury retail sector a plus
Team player, energetic and results oriented
Fluent in English and French (any additional languages are a plus)
Ability to travel, 5-10% of the time, including internationally
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst for one of our clients in the St Gallen area.




In this role, you will handle the creation and execution of BI analytics, design and model workflows, and drive the optimization and automation of business processes. You'll also be tasked with data analysis and interpretation, developing and overseeing dashboards and reports, and maintaining data quality and accuracy.




If you have a degree in business informatics or computer science, expertise in data analysis and BI, complemented by experience with Python or R, and Power BI or Qlik, and excellent knowledge of German and English, this is the right opportunity for you!




If you want to hear more about this role, apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.
