Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Business Intelligence Analyst to join our BI EMEA team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let’s talk about the role!

As a BI Analyst, you have been already exposed to the BI subject matter, either at the University or in a first work experience. You will participate in the design and deployment of key strategic BI Solutions. You will support your Lead Manager in daily activities to ensure product adoption and contribute to the verification and continuous improvement of reporting data quality. Direct exposure to the end-user community is crucial in this role, as is an advanced ability to conceptualize and test solutions from source system to BI solutions.




Job Details




We expect you to deliver unbeatable results while fulfilling the following aspects of the BI Analyst role:

Gather and understand Business Requirements
Transform Business Requirements into Logical Data Models and high-level Technical Requirements
Communicate the gathered information with the technical team
Implement reports as a Superuser
Manage incidents and provide support to the Business Community in addressing their data/tools challenges




Skills For Success

To succeed as a BI Analyst, you must translate our business objectives into a coherent BI design, follow up with the implementation team, double-check the final deliverables, and follow-up their adoption in the Business Community. Strong empathy and influencing skills will help you get both the business and the technical team on board. We are looking for someone with a service-oriented approach who has:




An attitude of teamwork, aiding colleagues in resolving issues, and hastening your own learning curve about the technical landscape and business processes
A general understanding of Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse applications
Understanding of Data Modeling principles
Hands-on experience in data investigations
Experience with Visual Insight platforms (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, IBM Cognos preferred)
Experience with relational data access (SAP HANA, SQL Server, Redshift…)
Exposure to Fashion/Retail industries in prior experiences is considered a plus
Knowledge of the main SAP GUI, back-end tables, and their interactions is considered a plus




Other key skills for success:




Teamwork attitude, good interaction, and communication skills
Ability to handle Change Management
Focus on the end-user community
Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Analytical mindset
Ability to escalate to the appropriate level of support
Efficiency and effectiveness in dealing with end-users
Fluency in spoken and written English




VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com




What’s In It For You

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.




A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks




This post is not eligible for relocation support.




Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.




As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.




If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Title: Data Business Analyst
Description:
Tisseur de liens, créateur de tendances et porteur d’influence depuis plus de 20 ans en Suisse, nous avons l’ambition de devenir le 1er retailleur du pays sur le marché online de la maison.







Vous êtes tenté(e) par de nouveaux défis dans une entreprise au fort potentiel de croissance ? Vous avez envie de grandir professionnellement dans une société qui fait toute sa place à l’humain et à la proactivité ?







Rejoignez un acteur majeur du e-commerce dans le secteur de la mode et de la maison. La Redoute Suisse, filiale d’un groupe français, bénéficie des avantages d’un grand groupe (forte dimension internationale, possibilité d’évolution) et d’une PME (autonomie, confiance managériale).







Pour notre filiale basée en Suisse, à Montreux, au sein de notre département IT-Data nous recherchons un(e) :







Data Business Analyst à 100%







VOS MISSIONS




Véritable business partenaire, ses clients sont transverses et ses partenaires principaux sont l’IT, la finance, la logistique, le marketing produit et la relation client.




Il identifie les besoins en data de la filiale selon les axes d’analyses formulés par le plan stratégique de l’entreprise et les besoins des business partners.




Via des extractions ad hoc, il aide à mettre en place des analyses permettant d’optimiser des processus métier et de faciliter la prise de décision.




Dans le cadre du plan de transformation de l’entreprise, il accompagne les équipes projets à cadrer les besoins, comprendre les enjeux et en mesurer la performance




Dans ce sens, il met à disposition des utilisateurs et business partners des data fiables sous la forme de tables, modèle de données, tableaux et bord et reporting (Excel, Power BI, Power Query…).




Il est garant du maintien, de la véracité et de la mise à jour des reporting existants.




Il met à disposition des équipes marketing et de contrôle de gestion les données et outils nécessaires à la construction du budget et des forecast.










VOTRE PROFIL




Formation équivalent Master en statistique / économétrie, master spécialisé Big data ou bien en HEG/HEC avec une spécialisation data science / analytics
Expérience souhaitée de 2 ans minimum sur un poste similaire.
Orientation et sensibilité business forte afin de comprendre les enjeux de l’entreprise
Parfaites connaissances en langages SQL standard, DAX, Power Query et de l’environnement Power BI (éventuellement Python)
Parle couramment Français et Anglais
Sens de l’organisation, capable de gérer plusieurs projets en même temps
Curiosité, dynamisme et esprit d’équipe










NOTRE ENTREPRISE







La Redoute est certifiée Great Place to Work et fut élue 5ème Small Best Workplace en Suisse en 2022 et 2023. La bonne ambiance, l’entre-aide et le cadre de travail sont des atouts reconnus par l’ensemble de nos collaborateurs.




A deux pas de la gare de Montreux et face au lac, la Redoute est idéalement placée et les locaux sont chaleureux et agréables.




Au-delà des nombreuses prestations sociales et avantages collaborateurs, nous tenons à ce que nos collaborateurs conservent un bon équilibre vie privée, vie professionnelle en proposant des heures de travail flexibles, récupérables et en bénéficiant de 2 jours de télétravail par semaine.




Vous vous êtes reconnu dans cette annonce et même si vous ne cochez pas toutes les cases, n’hésitez pas à nous adresser votre dossier de candidature complet, car vous êtes peut-être la personne que nous recherchons.

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more
HTML:
Profil du candidat

  • You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
  • You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
  • Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Job Information

Galliker verfügt über ein Netzwerk mit umfassenden Logistikdienstleistungen in all seinen nationalen und internationalen Betrieben. Umso wichtiger ist es, die komplexen Geschäftsprozesse durch eine zeitnahe Bereitstellung relevanter Informationen zu optimieren.

Zum Ausbau unseres Data Analytics Teams in Altishofen (Luzern) suchen wir eine motivierte und verantwortungsbewusste Person als Data Analyst mit Schwerpunkt Power BI. Als Data Analyst übernimmst du Verantwortung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer cloudbasierten Datenplattform und gestaltest die Business Intelligence und Analytics Strategie proaktiv mit.

Jetzt Bewerben

Aufgabengebiet


Weiterentwickeln der Datenarchitektur basierend auf den Azure Analytics Services
Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines


Anforderungsprofil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Angebot


Motiviertes, kollegiales und wachsendes Team
Vielzahl an interessanten Analytics Use Cases mit unternehmensweitem Impact
Kurze Entscheidungswege
Agile Arbeitsweisen und eine topmoderne IT-Infrastruktur
Möglichkeit von Remotearbeit
Breites Einsatzgebiet in der Welt von Transport & Logistik mit internationalen Kontakten


Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsort

Schweiz

Hauptsitz Altishofen

Kantonsstrasse 2

CH-6246 Altishofen

Mit direktem Autobahnanschluss zur Hauptverkehrsachse der A2 und Gotthardbahnlinie ist Altishofen verkehrstechnisch optimal gelegen.

Route

mehr erfahren

Benefits

Das erwartet dich bei uns

Mindestens 5 Wochen Ferien

fortschrittliche eigene

Galliker-Pensionskasse

Flache hierarchie & Du-Kultur

kurze Entscheidungswege

Kostenlose Parkplätze

& gute ÖV-Anbindung

Interne Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

Jetzt Bewerben
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist for one of our clients in the Lucerne area.

In this position, you'll be responsible for developing the BI system, generating reports and data visualizations for internal users, gathering the needs of different departments and managers, identifying necessary data and reports, and creating and updating reports and evaluations to aid decision-making. You'll collaborate closely with business experts to achieve these tasks.

If you have a degree in business informatics, complemented by experience with Power BI and SQL, and excellent knowledge of German and English, this is the right opportunity for you!

Experience in Qlik is an advantage.

If you want to hear more about this role, apply directly.

Title: Data Engineer (100% Remote - Switzerland)
Description:
About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code to construct data pipelines.
Work closely with data scientists and analysts to understand and fulfill their data requirements.
Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of data pipelines.
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
Maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Collaborate with teams to integrate systems.
4+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Experience with machine learning algorithms and libraries.
Familiarity with data visualization tools.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer (m/w/d)




Are you in search of a meaningful and rewarding career path as a Data Engineer?




We are seeking for a new talent as a Data Engineer (m/w/d) to join the Data & AI team where you will have the opportunity to collaborate in the project for the telecommunications company in Switzerland, providing a wide range of services to both residential and business customers.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, and databases.




If you are passionate about data engineering and excited to work on a telecommunication project, we would love to hear from you!




Primary Skill: Data Engineering







Responsibilities:

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions for data generation, collection, and processing.
Your main tasks will include creating data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and implementing ETL (extract, transform, and load) processes to migrate and deploy data across systems.
You are expected to be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with deep knowledge in Data Engineering.
You will act in an advisory role in meetings and be the primary contact (go-to person) for your area of expertise.
Additionally, you will be responsible for publishing on your area of expertise within and outside of our client, as well as presenting on your area of expertise at conferences.
You will also be expected to provide solutions to business areas and client-wide problems, contribute to and be held directly and indirectly responsible for business area decisions, and define business area goals.
Design and develop innovative data solutions to optimize data generation, collection, and processing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and integrity.
Implement and maintain efficient data pipelines for seamless data migration and deployment.
Conduct data analysis and provide insights to drive business decisions.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Data Engineering to continuously improve processes and solutions.




Your skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
At least 5 years working experience as a Data Engineer
Proficiency in Data Engineering at an Expert level is required.
Proven experience with Data Migrations, Data Access, Data Pipelines, and Data Processing at an Expert level are recommended.
Experience with cloud platforms: AWS, Azure a plus.
Strong programming skills in Python, Java a plus
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy in big data sets
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
Experience in the telecommunication industry a plus
Language skills: English (C1), German (C1)




General Information:

Start date: 09.09.2023
End date: 28.02.2025
Extension: is an option
Workplace: Bern
Workload: 100%
Onsite Presence: Switzerland, 80% onsite work is required in Bern
Opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Exposure to innovative projects and technology
Competitive pay rate and benefits package

Show more

  • You will also be expected to provide solutions to business areas and client-wide problems, contribute to and be held directly and indirectly responsible for business area decisions, and define business area goals.
  • Design and develop innovative data solutions to optimize data generation, collection, and processing.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and integrity.
  • Implement and maintain efficient data pipelines for seamless data migration and deployment.
  • Conduct data analysis and provide insights to drive business decisions.
  • Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Data Engineering to continuously improve processes and solutions.


Your skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
  • At least 5 years working experience as a Data Engineer
  • Proficiency in Data Engineering at an Expert level is required.
  • Proven experience with Data Migrations, Data Access, Data Pipelines, and Data Processing at an Expert level are recommended.
  • Experience with cloud platforms: AWS, Azure a plus.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, Java a plus
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy in big data sets
  • Strong communication and teamwork abilities
  • Experience in the telecommunication industry a plus
  • Language skills: English (C1), German (C1)


General Information:

  • Start date: 09.09.2023
  • End date: 28.02.2025
  • Extension: is an option
  • Workplace: Bern
  • Workload: 100%
  • Onsite Presence: Switzerland, 80% onsite work is required in Bern
  • Opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Exposure to innovative projects and technology
  • Competitive pay rate and benefits package

Title: business e data analyst
Company: Federal Office for Buildings and Logistics FOBL
Description:
L'Ufficio federale delle costruzioni e della logistica UFCL cerca un/a:

business e data analyst

80%-100% / Berna

Apprezza una collaborazione di successo?

Tramite l'analisi dei dati e un'ampia comprensione dei nessi immobiliari, contribuirà a sviluppare ulteriormente il nostro portafoglio immobiliare unico nel suo genere. Grazie alla sua capacità di lavorare in modo strategico e concettuale, potrà tradurre i requisiti interdisciplinari derivanti dalla gestione immobiliare e dal settore della sostenibilità in una gestione efficace dei dati. Nel nostro Ufficio avrà la possibilità di realizzare la sua passione per l'elaborazione e l'analisi dei dati a favore di una gestione sostenibile degli immobili.

Le Sue mansioni


Svolgere analisi di dati e modellazioni per riconoscere tendenze e modelli e illustrare previsioni di sviluppo
Acquisire ed elaborare dati e implementare le procedure di controllo della qualità
Valutare dati e fattori ambientali per promuovere la sostenibilità nel settore immobiliare e seguirne gli sviluppi
Fornire supporto allo sviluppo e all'attuazione di strategie aziendali attraverso conoscenze fondate sui dati e la loro visualizzazione
Dirigere progetti d'attuazione dal punto di vista tecnico, organizzativo e del personale


Il Suo profilo


Formazione di livello terziario (università, SUP) in informatica, data science, business analytics o informatica di gestione con esperienza o formazione continua nella gestione sostenibile degli immobili
Grande affinità con i sistemi digitali, capacità di operare in un'ottica economico-aziendale, metodo di lavoro analitico e concettuale
Esperienza professionale nell'analisi aziendale e dei dati nonché nell'ingegneria e nella gestione dei requisiti
Capacità di adattamento in un ambiente in costante evoluzione ed esperienza in diversi settori della gestione del cambiamento
Capacità di fissare priorità e promuovere compiti e progetti in modo efficiente
Buone conoscenze attive di due lingue ufficiali e dell'inglese


Informazioni complementari

Per Ulteriori Informazioni è a Disposizione

Signor Daniel Züger, capo Gestione degli immobili, tel. 058 465 31 28

Ulteriori informazioni sono disponibili sul nostro sito Internet , su LinkedIn e Instagram . La invitiamo a consultare la pagina che indica i vantaggi offerti dall'Amministrazione federale ai suoi collaboratori . #lavorareperlasvizzera

Si prega di candidarsi tramite il nostro sistema di gestione delle candidature. A tal fine, cliccare su «Per candidarsi».

Numero di riferimento: 620-11673

Chi siamo

L'UFCL è sinonimo di tradizione e modernità e conta circa 900 collaboratori di varie professioni. Sostenibile ed esemplare, l'Ufficio si impegna nei confronti delle prossime generazioni. L'individualità dei collaboratori e l'entusiasmo con cui si dedicano al proprio lavoro e alla definizione di nuovi standard fanno dell'UFCL uno degli Uffici federali più interessanti e polivalenti.

L'Amministrazione federale è attenta alle necessità e ai diversi vissuti dei suoi collaboratori e ne apprezza la diversità. La parità di trattamento gode della massima priorità.

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our IoT Lab team, responsible for developing BOBST Connect, our all-in-one digital platform that enhances and improves packaging productivity. BOBST Connect brings data and digital services together in one fully connected cloud platform, with BOBST machine insights and expertise built-in, enabling overview and orchestration of the production process. You will be an integral part of the agile organization responsible for developing this innovative product, constantly evolving to serve our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with our business stakeholders, IoT product management team, development teams, and other Data Scientists to define new products, services, and tools using data and machine learning. As a member of the team, you will work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets. You will also be responsible for supporting the teams with data operational tasks.

Please note this is a hands-on role, involving a lot of data crunching: if you are looking for a management or supervisory position, this is not for you, as we strive to keep a flat hierarchy with very productive and operational teams.

Main Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy data-driven solutions to answer a variety of business problems (predictive maintenance, equipment lifecycle analysis, etc.)
Understand the requirements of product owners and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Design and implement data pipelines and data warehouses to support data analysis and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Mentor and coach developers on best practices in data analysis, modelling, and visualization.
Keep up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, and apply them to solve business problems.


Your Education And Languages Capabilities


Bachelor in Computer Science or Data Science (Master or PHD a plus)
Full professional proficiency in English. French an asset.


Your technical Knowledge


Advanced proficiency in programming languages (ideally Python), and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, or standard libraries (D3/Plotly/...).
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


At least 3 years in a similar role
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive (experience with Databricks is a big plus).
Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Microsoft Azure).
Experience with Agile/Scrum disciplines based on Azure DevOps


Your personal attributes


A true believer in the value of data, with the ability to take ownership and deliver autonomously and proactively tangible results to the organization.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including very senior managers.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to identify patterns and insights in large data sets.
Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure data accuracy and completeness, while keeping solutions as simple and robust as possible.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in an agile environment, including the ability to manage priorities and give regular reporting on ongoing tasks.
Continuous learning mindset, keeping up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer (m/w/d)




Are you in search of a meaningful and rewarding career path as a Data Engineer?




We are seeking for a new talent as a Data Engineer (m/w/d) to join the Data & AI team where you will have the opportunity to collaborate in the project for the telecommunications company in Switzerland, providing a wide range of services to both residential and business customers.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines, and databases.




If you are passionate about data engineering and excited to work on a telecommunication project, we would love to hear from you!




Primary Skill: Data Engineering







Responsibilities:

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions for data generation, collection, and processing.
Your main tasks will include creating data pipelines, ensuring data quality, and implementing ETL (extract, transform, and load) processes to migrate and deploy data across systems.
You are expected to be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with deep knowledge in Data Engineering.
You will act in an advisory role in meetings and be the primary contact (go-to person) for your area of expertise.
Additionally, you will be responsible for publishing on your area of expertise within and outside of our client, as well as presenting on your area of expertise at conferences.
You will also be expected to provide solutions to business areas and client-wide problems, contribute to and be held directly and indirectly responsible for business area decisions, and define business area goals.
Design and develop innovative data solutions to optimize data generation, collection, and processing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and integrity.
Implement and maintain efficient data pipelines for seamless data migration and deployment.
Conduct data analysis and provide insights to drive business decisions.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Data Engineering to continuously improve processes and solutions.




Your skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Data Science, Engineering or a related field.
At least 5 years working experience as a Data Engineer
Proficiency in Data Engineering at an Expert level is required.
Proven experience with Data Migrations, Data Access, Data Pipelines, and Data Processing at an Expert level are recommended.
Experience with cloud platforms: AWS, Azure a plus.
Strong programming skills in Python, Java a plus
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy in big data sets
Strong communication and teamwork abilities
Experience in the telecommunication industry a plus
Language skills: English (C1), German (C1)




General Information:

Start date: 09.09.2023
End date: 28.02.2025
Extension: is an option
Workplace: Bern
Workload: 100%
Onsite Presence: Switzerland, 80% onsite work is required in Bern
Opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Exposure to innovative projects and technology
Competitive pay rate and benefits package

Title: Consumer and Data Driven, Insight Analyst - Internship Program
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland.

VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey aim to develop and boost future talents on their early career path. As we are in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy, and commitment of our people, you can expect a dedicated and structured learning path and hands-on experience.




About Vf

VF Corporation is one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish most through a family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands including Vans®, The North Face®, Timberland® and Dickies®. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling.




INTERNSHIP ROLE




We are looking for a Consumer and Data-Driven Insight Analyst to join the EMEA Strategy and CI Team within VF EMEA Internship Program.




KEY INTERNSHIP INFO

Start date: October 1st 2024.
For the first 6 months your salary will be 1600chf/month, while for the following 6 months it is 1900chf/month.
We cannot grant that internship will lead you to the permanent position, but thanks to the effective training 70% of interns are staying in the company after the internship period!




What You Will Learn

Ability to mine, analyse and leverage consumer and market data to address Business questions and help inform decisions
Work with different data sets to inform Business decisions i.e. know which data resource to leverage, learn different analysis approaches and techniques
Leverage data to generate insights
Visualize and present data in a clear manner
Develop an understanding of how to measure and impact marketing effectiveness and efficiency
Collaborate internally and externally with key partners to analyse and report the impact of marketing activities
Understand key marketing / media strategies to drive brand growth
Understand key tenants of digital marketing and media effectiveness and efficiency
Learn to use analytical problem solving to make better decisions
Learn priority-setting and planning
Learn to effectively collaborate and communicate with impact




How You Will Make a Difference

You will have a student status while beginning an internship or you have graduated already before in 2024 – it’s a must.
You are fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
You have curious mindset with passion for working with people.
You are eager to learn and face up new challenges.
First experience such as other internships, extracurricular activities, is considered as a plus.

What’s In It For You

Tailored 12-month development path.
An inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together.
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do.
Access to the gym and subsidized canteen in the office.
Up to 50% discounts on our brands.
Shuttle bus to the office or discount to public transport (dependent on your location).




ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!




R-20240722-0029

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




Are you an experienced Data Engineer with strong experience as a Data Engineer or BI Developer? And have strong experience with Azure, Power BI and Python. At the same time have strong experience with DWH and building Data Pipelines. Then this could be your chance!




You will be developing optimal Data Models for storage and developing end-to-end Data Pipelines. You will also provide implementation support on various Data Management and analytics projects. Ensure the effective design and development of systems architectures through product deliveries.




You will join a team of Data Engineers and BI Developers; the role requires high collaboration with other data engineers and stakeholders. Therefore, for this role, you need to have excellent communication skills along with a can-do attitude and a ready-to-face challenges mindset. You speak both fluent German and English.




For more information on this Data Engineer position or any other Data positions we have available, send your CV to daniel.imre@nicollcurtin.com or alternatively, you can call me on +41 43 215 45 15

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




Are you an experienced Data Engineer with strong experience as a Data Engineer or BI Developer? And have strong experience with Azure, Spark, Python and Palantir Foundry. At the same time have strong experience with DWH and building Data Pipelines. Then this could be your chance!




You will be developing optimal Data Models for storage and developing end-to-end Data Pipelines. You will also provide implementation support on various Data Management and analytics projects. Ensure the effective design and development of systems architectures through product deliveries.




You will join a team of Data Engineers and BI Developers; the role requires high collaboration with other data engineers and stakeholders. Therefore, for this role, you need to have excellent communication skills along with a can-do attitude and a ready-to-face challenges mindset. You speak both fluent German and English.




For more information on this Data Engineer position or any other Data positions we have available, send your CV to daniel.imre@nicollcurtin.com or you can call me at +41 43 215 45 15

Title: Business & Life Cycle Data Analyst
Description:
Wir suchen einen erfahrenen Business & Life Cycle Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Real Estate, der die Digitalisierungsprojekte unseres Kunden auf das nächste Level hebt. In dieser Schlüsselposition übernimmst du die Leitung und Steuerung von Projekten, die die Digitalisierung und Effizienzsteigerung im Bau- und Betriebsprozess vorantreiben. Wenn du Eigeninitiative, konzeptionelle Stärke und eine ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung mitbringst, ist diese Position ideal für dich.




Deine Aufgaben




Du übernimmst die Leitung und Steuerung von Digitalisierungsprojekten in allen Projekt- und SIA-Phasen, mit Schwerpunkt auf Bau- und Betriebsprozesse (TGM/IGM).
Du nutzt dein Verständnis für Geschäftsprozesse zur Entwicklung von Konzepten im Bereich der Digitalisierung im Immobiliensektor.
Gemeinsam fördern wir die Weiterentwicklung von BIM + AIM TGM/IGM.
Du stellst sicher, dass die BIM-Methode im Projekt praktisch umgesetzt wird und nicht nur Theorie bleibt.
In grösseren Projekten repräsentierst du die strategische Ausrichtung von BIM.
Situationsbedingt übernimmst du auch operative BIM-Aufgaben und setzt diese direkt um.




Dein Profil




Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine Weiterbildung in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Immobilienmanagement, Betriebswirtschaft, Architektur oder Ingenieurwesen.
Idealerweise hast du eine Zusatzqualifikation in Digital Real Estate Management, Digital Construction oder ähnlichen Bereichen der digitalen Transformation.
Du bringst Berufserfahrung und starke konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten in den relevanten Bereichen mit.
Deine hohe Sozialkompetenz und Fähigkeiten in der Projektleitung sowie deine Motivation zeichnen dich aus.
Eigeninitiative und Selbstorganisation sind deine Stärken, Zuverlässigkeit und Kundenorientierung deine Basis.
Du bist ein Teamplayer und eine wichtige Unterstützung für das Digital Real Estate Team.
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab.

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Lead
Description:
About MS Reinsurance

MS Reinsurance is a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland with underwriting offices in Zurich, Bermuda, Miami, and New York. The Company underwrites non-life treaty reinsurance solutions on a worldwide basis through its three business units: Americas, International, and Specialty Lines. As part of the world-leading insurance group MS&AD, MS Reinsurance combines reliability and agility to make its clients’ businesses stronger. With a drive to move quickly and a commitment to long term partnership, MS Reinsurance supports its partners with the momentum and stability they can build on.




About the role

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Lead who will drive MS Reinsurance BI initiatives and play a pivotal role in execution data strategy across the organization. You will not only oversee the BI department but also actively contribute as an analyst and developer. You have a strong background in data analytics, BI solution development, and data engineering with specialized experience in Azure, Databricks and Power BI platforms.




Your responsibilities

Lead and manage the BI team, setting strategic direction and ensuring alignment with the organization’s goals.
Design, develop, and maintain scalable and robust BI solutions using Azure, Power BI, and other relevant technologies.
Support the development and implementation of data warehouses, data lakes, and other data platforms.
Translate complex business requirements into non-technical, lay terms and vice versa, defining clear business metrics and ROI.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to identify business needs and opportunities for improvement through data analysis and BI solutions.
Conduct complex data analysis and create reports to provide actionable insights that support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure the integrity, availability, and security of data throughout the data lifecycle.
Keep abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies in BI and data analytics, making recommendations for improvements and innovations.
Mentor and train team members on analytical techniques, data handling, and BI tool usage.




Your profile

8+ years experience in the BI area
Good communication skills (English proficiency is a must)
Power BI expert
Expert in Design thinking methodology
Experience in managing teams
Azure certified DevOps Engineer
Experienced to work in agile teams (Scrum / Kanban)
Leadership skills with experience managing and leading BI teams and projects
Strong competency in Microsoft Azure, including Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Data Warehouse / Lakehouse, Power BI, Power Automate, Power App and Logic App, Data Quality and other Azure services
Expert with Power BI creating dynamic dashboards meaningful reports telling a data story by producing end products and good suer experience
Deep understanding with data modelling, SQL, DAX, Python and other programming languages including data warehousing principals
Excellent analytics skills with the ability to collect, analyse, organize and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization







What we offer

We offer a modern workplace, an entrepreneurial culture with room for innovation and a hybrid work model. Collaboration, Empowerment and Responsibilities are key values we live on a day-to-day basis. You will be part of a hands-on culture where you really can make an impact. We place mutual trust at the forefront of our collaboration and path to growth.




Note that we will only consider applicants eligible to work in Switzerland.




In case of questions, please contact us via email: careers@msreinsurance.com




MS Reinsurance is the market-facing brand of the risk carrying legal entity MS Amlin AG, a global reinsurer domiciled in Switzerland and operating in Bermuda as MS Amlin AG, Bermuda Branch, in the United States through MS Amlin Reinsurance Managers, Inc, and in Labuan, Malaysia as MS Amlin AG, Labuan Branch.

Title: Junior IT Project Manager / Data Analyst 100% (m/w/d)
Description:
DEINE VERANTWORTUNGSVOLLE AUFGABE




Als IT Project Manager / Data Analyst übernimmst du eine zentrale Rolle in unserer IT-Abteilung. Zum einen bist du mitverantwortlich für die Planung und Durchführung von IT-Projekten und zum anderen nutzt du deine Expertise in der Datenanalyse, um strategische Entscheidungen für das gesamte Unternehmen zu unterstützen. Dazu unterstützt du das Team bei diversen, abwechslungsreichen Tasks.




Folgende Aufgaben gehören zu deinem vielfältigen Arbeitsgebiet:

Planung und Realisierung von neuen Projekten in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Entwicklungsteam
Sammlung, Analyse und Interpretation von Daten aus verschiedenen Geschäftsbereichen
Bereitstellung von strategischen Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Unternehmensentscheidungen und zur Optimierung von Prozessen
Unterstützung bei der kontinuierlichen Digitalisierung und Ausarbeitung neuer Prozesse und Abläufen




DAS BIST DU

Du bist ein IT-Allrounder mit Erfahrung und Freude an Projektmanagement
Du bringst nachweisbare Erfahrung in der Analyse grosser Datensätze und in der Anwendung von Analysetools sowie SQL-Skills mit
Du bist begeisterter Fan von AI und hast Freude, Prozesse damit zu optimieren
Dank vernetztem Denken und einer proaktiven Art findest du immer schnelle und pragmatische Lösungen
Eine ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen persönlichen Stärken




DAS ERWARTET DICH

Wir bieten dir eine Umgebung, wo du deinen Ideen freien Lauf lassen kannst. Wir sind neuen Technologien ggü. sehr aufgeschlossen
Ein abwechslungsreiches und verantwortungsvolles Aufgabengebiet in einem interessanten Arbeitsumfeld mit Freiräumen für selbstständiges Arbeiten und weiteren Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten
Spass bei der Arbeit mit einem engagierten und familiären Team, in welches wir dich gern kollegial integrieren
Kurze Dienstwege
Ein perfekt gelegener Standort und top ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz in unserem neuen Büro in Baden (AG)
Eine moderne IT-Ausstattung nach Wahl inkl. Macbook oder Windows Laptop
42 Stunden Woche mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und moderner Zeiterfassungssoftware
Möglichkeit einen Teil der Arbeitszeit im Home Office zu absolvieren
13 Monatslohn
25 Tage Ferien
Ein gratis Parkplatz oder ein Zustupf für deine ÖV-Kosten
So viele Früchte, Mineralwasser, Kaffee und Tee wie du brauchst, um fit und gesund zu bleiben
Attraktiver Rabatt auf unsere Produkte
Regelmässige Teamevents und Füürobebier
Show more

Title: PL/SQL developer

Develop and integrate a Master Data platform for their applications

Develop new system features and improve existing ones
Collaborate with users to prioritize and design technical solutions

English fluent

C#, C++, or Python
French is an asset

Home office : 1 day per week
Annual bonus
EU Citizen

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Notre mission :

Ivy Partners est une société de conseil Suisse qui contribue à l’évolution des entreprises dans leurs enjeux stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.

Notre objectif aujourd’hui est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui contribuera positivement à leur épanouissement et à leur bien-être, en les faisant monter en compétences et en leur offrant de réelles perspectives d’évolution.

En tant que Data Engineer chez IVY Partners, vous serez en charge de :

Gérer un important flux de données au sein du Data Warehouse
Compiler et traiter des données provenant de divers fournisseurs selon la logique métier.
Maintenir, optimiser et développer le Data Warehouse basé sur Snowflake.
Collaborer avec l'équipe technique pour assurer l'intégrité et la performance des données.
Participer à la création de rapports et de tableaux de bord pour les clients et prospects.




Profil :

Maîtrise indispensable de SQL pour la manipulation et gestion des données.
Expérience nécessaire avec Snowflake ou équivalent (ex : DataBricks, Denodo) sont acceptées.
Bonne compréhension de l'environnement cloud, en particulier AWS.
Connaissance essentielle avec Python
Connaissance de terraform souhaitée mais non obligatoire.
Capacité à monter en compétence et à s'adapter aux évolutions technologiques.
Attitude proactive et capacité à travailler en équipe.




🤝 Ivy, c’est aussi :

La bienveillance | Soucieux de nos employés, nous leur garantissons un environnement favorable où chacun est valorisé et se voit offrir des formations et des perspectives d’évolution en Suisse ou à l’international.

La confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est développer un partenariat fondé sur la confiance, le professionnalisme et la transparence à chaque instant.

L’innovation | Nous garantissons une transformation numérique efficace grâce à l’innovation technologique couplée à la créativité.

La responsabilité | Le collectif est à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons, et nous prenons cette responsabilité au sérieux en mettant tout en œuvre pour avoir un impact positif.

🚀 Rejoindre Ivy, c’est prendre part à une aventure stimulante à chaque instant ! Merci d'envisager de nous rejoindre, nous sommes impatients d'en savoir plus sur vous !

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Data Engineer to help drive business decisions by using the power of data. The Data Engineer will join the EMEA Business Analytics Team based in Cham, Switzerland. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building, developing and maintain the data infrastructure and pipeline for delivering advanced analytical solutions and data products. This role is critical for shaping our data strategy and supporting data-driven decision making across the organization.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with the data team to develop business intelligence (BI) data products, empowering and accelerating business processes
Set up and maintain infrastructure for data science use cases, including ELT pipelines, machine learning models, and app deployment, using various open-source tools. As part of this role, you’ll also act as a half-platform engineer
Work closely with BI, IT, and data engineering peers to identify optimal solutions on private cloud
Design, develop, and curate data pipelines to maintain reliable and well-curated data sources, enhancing productivity
Bring best practices to the entire lifecycle of data products, from development and testing to deployment and ongoing maintenance
Develop a deep understanding of data based on business acumen, collaborating closely with data scientists, business analysts, and business stakeholders
Communicate technical and business topics effectively, using written, verbal, and presentation materials as needed



What You'll Bring


Experience in creating data pipelines using SQL and Python, with a strong proficiency in both
Familiarity with Linux, Kubernetes, Airflow, and CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of best practices for database design within relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Vertica)
Experience with Mlflow and Kubeflow is a plus
Exposure to data products, including dashboards and machine learning models
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude, capable of finding solutions with minimal guidance
A team player with a growth mindset, possessing excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills. You’ll be able to deliver on tight deadlines in alignment with business requirements



, Tesla

Title: Expert(e) Data & BI / Qliksence
Description:
Expert(e) Data & BI- Secteur banque / finance




Stack technique: #Qliksense#SQL #Avaloq #Greenplum




Nous recherchons un ou une Expert(e) Data & BI- Secteur banque / finance pour rejoindre une notre client, une banque privée sur Genève ou Paris. Ce poste s'adresse à un profil confirmé /senior avec au moins 8 ans d'expérience, doté d'une solide capacité d'analyse et d'innovation.




🔓 Ce que nous offrons :

Un Projet Ambitieux : Participer à des projets de reporting BI avancés dans un environnement financier exigeant.
Processus de Recrutement Rapide : Chez Darwin Partners on sait que votre temps est précieux. Pas de perte de temps avec de multiples entretiens et tests techniques. Nous nous engageons à un processus de recrutement rapide et efficace.
Équipe de Haut Niveau : Rejoignez un groupe d'experts où l'excellence et l'innovation sont la norme.




🔎 Activités 🔎

Concevoir et mettre en place des solutions BI innovantes pour répondre aux besoins de l'entreprise.
Analyser les données et les modèles afin d'optimiser les performances.
Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données.
Participer activement à la mise en place de l'architecture BI
Développer et optimiser les processus ETL.
Analyser les besoins métiers et concevoir des modèles de données appropriés.
Concevoir des tableaux de bord et des visualisations de données avec Qliksense.
Assurer l'intégration des données provenant de diverses sources et garantir leur qualité.
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes techniques et métiers pour déployer des solutions BI adaptées.
Former les utilisateurs finaux à l'utilisation des outils BI et des tableaux de bord développés.







🎭Votre profil / compétences / qualités🎭




Maîtrise de Qliksense
Connaissance d'Avaloq est un atout
Reporting sur greeplum
Idéalement connaissances Dataops et Machine Learning
Connaissances en contrôle de Gestion / Finance
Expérience en ETL, intégration de données, et gestion de bases de données.
Compétences en modélisation de données et création de tableaux de bord interactifs.
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages de requête (SQL).
Bonne compréhension des processus métier et capacité à transformer des besoins en solutions BI efficaces.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à communiquer efficacement.
Autonomie et rigueur dans le travail.
Capacité d'adaptation et d'innovation face aux défis techniques.
Vous parlez Français et Anglais
Vous avez au moins 8 ans d'expérience




🛎️ Informations complémentaires🛎️




Poste basé à Genève ou Paris
Mission long terme

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an Data Engineer to work on a project with our client based in Switzerland.




This role is a long term contracted position, with the option to extend. It is operated on a fully remote basis from Switzerland.




Responsibilities & Activities:

Create interactive visualizations and dashboards to communicate complex information clearly and concisely using as Power BI
Work with the data analyst team to understand information needs and design appropriate visualizations.
Use data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Einstein Analytics etc.)
Help automate data visualization processes through scripting and programming.
Transform, enrich, and prepare data for analysis and visualization in Dashboards.
Design, update, and control of daily and weekly reporting.
Present and communicate analysis results.
Support business stakeholders through data visualization and manage backlog of requests through an agile framework.
Focusing on AWS Data Lake, realtime pipelines, ETL and data activation.
Participate in the development of our AWS Data Lake/Data Mesh through different methods of data ingestion and using best AWS ETL tools AWS Glue, AWS Lambda , AWS Kubernetes , AWS crawlers
Play a pivotal role in the process of moving towards microservices and event-driven architecture
Be part of the Data organization, building and operating the core technologies that enable data scientists, analysts and the different business units to leverage rich data in efficient and innovative ways to generate impact and connect people to the most relevant real-world experiences.
Own and maintain critical data pipelines for our AWS Data lake and the resulting data products that are used daily across the company to inform all sorts of decisions and models.
Are an analytical and conceptual thinker, who thinks about Data architecture on a strategic level;
Implementing Data pipelines in an AWS Data lake through tools such as AWS Glue, AWS Lambda , AWS Kubernetes, Terraform




Requirements:

Excellent visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, typography, colour, interaction design and fluency with BI tools.
2+ years of professional experience designing interactive dashboards.
2+ years of software/data engineering experience
2+ years of professional experience designing big and scalable cloud data platforms - Data Streaming, Data Lake
Expertise in Python/, Spark, SQL, Terraform, Apache Spark, Docker and task orchestration tools (Airflow)
Expertise in AWS tools and concepts AWS Glue, AWS Lambda , AWS Kubernetes , AWS crawlers
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources
Expertise in Power BI or any other data visualization tool.




If you’re interested in discussing this opportunity in further detail then please feel free to submit an application via the job description, alternatively, email me on molham.kanawati@phaidoninternational.com with any questions.

Title: Business Analyst for Data Migration
Description:
Information and Document Systems is a global technology change and delivery organization comprising nearly 200 individuals located mostly in Switzerland, Poland and Singapore. Providing global capturing and document processing, archiving and retrieval solutions to all business divisions focusing on supporting Legal, Regulatory and Operational functions. At the moment developing strategic greenfield project to build large-scale digital archive for documents and records, that will gradually replace all existing archiving solutions in the bank, and to build an operational document store, that should become a single point of truth for document workflows. The whole system must scale linearly, be fault-tolerant, and handle petabytes of data.




Technologies used:

100% Scala using Functional Programming (FP),
Event Driven Architecture with Kafka as event store and Kafka Streams for event streaming,
Reactive streams for streaming data over HTTP: Akka HTTP/Streams,
Non-blocking concurrency: Akka, Monix,
FP abstractions: Cats,
Developed by several teams using Kanban




Responsibilities:

You will contribute to the design and documentation of business requirements, covering regulatory and legal archiving applications in addition to operational functionality to deliver end to end solutions to our stakeholders. The creation of the solution documentation strengthening of the systematic traceability from business request to application function is a vital part of the work. Teamwork and cross-discipline collaboration is essential.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Have 5+years' experience in business\system analysis, preferably in banking industry
Strong understanding of IT Technologies
Hands-on experience of working on a Migration (ETL) delivery
Excellent communication skills
Ability to form strong relationships with IT and Business
Have strong analytical skills
Object oriented design
Open minded and self-motivated
High level of competence in verbal and written English
Have very good understanding of business as well as technical language
Know Scrum framework and is ready to work that way




Nice-to-Have Skills Description:

Experience in the Archiving Domain
Experience of banking processes
Understanding of integration architecture
Create UML diagrams, data flow diagrams, ERD (diagrams




Languages:

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

Title: Data / Analytics Engineer (EMEA Remote)
Description:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 130 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology. The Opportunity ANYbotics is a leading robotics company specializing in advanced autonomous systems. With a successful Series B financing round recently closed, we are poised for rapid growth and international expansion. Our mission is to revolutionize the robotics industry through cutting-edge technology and innovation. As we embark on this exciting journey, we are seeking a dynamic, experienced and versatile Data & Analytics Engineer to join our #Ateam (Remotely) and help us shape the Future of Robotics. As Data & Analytics Engineer you are responsible for designing, developing and maintaining our BI Data Platform. This combined role will involve both Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering responsibilities to ensure a seamless process for centralizing business data from various sources and turning it into trusted analytics-ready data to serve business end users. The role is a crucial position as ANYbotics is committed to strengthen data-driven decision making. The role gives you the unique opportunity to work with the Director Business Intelligence to shape and deploy ANYbotics’ data and BI infrastructure to drive better business decisions and empower stakeholders to understand their business and customers in new ways. The Market & Our Technology ANYbotics transforms the industrial sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach (see our case studies in Chemicals, Oil & Gas, Railways, Wind Energy, Mining, Construction). Our customers are large asset operators and service providers of industrial plants pioneering robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our solution enables autonomous routine inspections and monitoring of large-scale industrial facilities for increased safety and productivity. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and software to achieve world-class mobility, autonomy, and inspection capabilities, often based on AI. We have proven the technology and the business impact on our customers in long-term pilot projects. We are now scaling the commercialization of our solution(s) and deploying directly into operation at customer facilities worldwide. Your Contributions


Build up and maintain a company-wide BI Data Platform (including integration of relevant source data)
Work closely with business and tool owners to understand data generating processes and convert raw business data into trusted and validated analytics-ready data sets
Design and implement data models, build data pipelines, and leverage SQL queries for clean, tested, documented and well-defined data data marts
Act as the technical expert to decide and build the best data extraction, storage, transformation and scheduling methods for different business use cases and data sources
Enforce data governance policies to maintain data integrity, security and quality



Your Profile


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field of study
Proven experience (3+ years) in a data engineering / analytics engineering role, including a track record in building a BI Data Platform
Expertise in SQL and experience with dbt
Hands-on experience implementing ETL/ELT processes
Strong programming skills in Python
Experience with cloud based data warehouses (ex. Snowflake, Redshift) and ETL/ELT tools (ex. Fivetran, Tray)
Experience with working with APIs to extract data from a variety of data sources
Can-do attitude and a very open and engaging personality with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders
Independent self-starter with well-structured ways of working
Experience with the modern data stack tools is a big plus
Ability to work with cloud platforms (ex. AWS) is a plus
Knowledge and experience with application of software engineering best practices to analytics code (ex. version control, CI/CD) is a plus
Bonus: Experience in a fast-growing high tech industrial company environment



We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Job Information

Galliker verfügt über ein Netzwerk mit umfassenden Logistikdienstleistungen in all seinen nationalen und internationalen Betrieben. Umso wichtiger ist es, die komplexen Geschäftsprozesse durch eine zeitnahe Bereitstellung relevanter Informationen zu optimieren.

Zum Ausbau unseres Data Analytics Teams in Altishofen (Luzern) suchen wir eine motivierte und verantwortungsbewusste Person als Data Analyst mit Schwerpunkt Power BI. Als Data Analyst übernimmst du Verantwortung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer cloudbasierten Datenplattform und gestaltest die Business Intelligence und Analytics Strategie proaktiv mit.

Jetzt Bewerben

Aufgabengebiet


Weiterentwickeln der Datenarchitektur basierend auf den Azure Analytics Services
Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines


Anforderungsprofil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Angebot


Motiviertes, kollegiales und wachsendes Team
Vielzahl an interessanten Analytics Use Cases mit unternehmensweitem Impact
Kurze Entscheidungswege
Agile Arbeitsweisen und eine topmoderne IT-Infrastruktur
Möglichkeit von Remotearbeit
Breites Einsatzgebiet in der Welt von Transport & Logistik mit internationalen Kontakten


Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsort

Schweiz

Hauptsitz Altishofen

Kantonsstrasse 2

CH-6246 Altishofen

Mit direktem Autobahnanschluss zur Hauptverkehrsachse der A2 und Gotthardbahnlinie ist Altishofen verkehrstechnisch optimal gelegen.

Route

mehr erfahren

Benefits

Das erwartet dich bei uns

Mindestens 5 Wochen Ferien

fortschrittliche eigene

Galliker-Pensionskasse

Flache hierarchie & Du-Kultur

kurze Entscheidungswege

Kostenlose Parkplätze

& gute ÖV-Anbindung

Interne Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

Jetzt Bewerben

Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines


Anforderungsprofil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Angebot


Motiviertes, kollegiales und wachsendes Team
Vielzahl an interessanten Analytics Use Cases mit unternehmensweitem Impact
Kurze Entscheidungswege
Agile Arbeitsweisen und eine topmoderne IT-Infrastruktur
Möglichkeit von Remotearbeit
Breites Einsatzgebiet in der Welt von Transport & Logistik mit internationalen Kontakten

Zum Ausbau unseres Data Analytics Teams in Altishofen (Luzern) suchen wir eine motivierte und verantwortungsbewusste Person als Data Analyst mit Schwerpunkt Power BI. Als Data Analyst übernimmst du Verantwortung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer cloudbasierten Datenplattform und gestaltest die Business Intelligence und Analytics Strategie proaktiv mit.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist for one of our clients in the Lucerne area.

In this position, you'll be responsible for developing the BI system, generating reports and data visualizations for internal users, gathering the needs of different departments and managers, identifying necessary data and reports, and creating and updating reports and evaluations to aid decision-making. You'll collaborate closely with business experts to achieve these tasks.

If you have a degree in business informatics, complemented by experience with Power BI and SQL, and excellent knowledge of German and English, this is the right opportunity for you!

Experience in Qlik is an advantage.

If you want to hear more about this role, apply directly.

Title: Internship - Data Analytics (Zurich, Switzerland)
Description:
What It's About

We are looking for an Intern to join our Data Office by September 2024 for 4 to 6 months

The main tasks will be the following:

Analyze data about companies in the CRM and Investment sourcing system and develop a model that identifies uniqueness, proposing cleansing actions to data stewards. Analyze data about companies across various systems, including the mapping from disparate application models to the unified model of the master data system, to propose de-duplication & mapping logic to be applied during data integration & mastering. Apply PG's AI LLM solutions to prototype an implementation that recognizes core entities within unstructured documents leveraging the pre-trained models with vectorized additional proprietary Partners Group input.

What we expect

Top performing students in the final phase of their study or who recently graduated from a top university, ideally focused on Computer Science or a Quantitative Degree Initial work experience in renowned firms in Technology, Data, Analytics or Consultancy is mandatory Proficiency using AI, LLMs or other data science approaches and Python coding skills Ability to complete projects on time and accurately, and to multi-task Strong analytical and people skills with excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to learn and succeed Proficiency in English is required

What we offer

Insights into and learnings into the data and analytics space from the world of investments at one of the world's leading private markets investment firms Flat management structure with significant exposure to senior leaders and decision makers Steep personal and technical learning curve in a supporting environment with a high degree of ownership and autonomy, yet with structured feedback and training www.partnersgroup.com

Please be aware, fraudsters may pose as Partners Group recruiters. All genuine representatives can be identified by a verified sign on their LinkedIn profiles. If you suspect fraud or have doubts, contact us immediately at hr@partnersgroup.com
Show more
