Title: business e data analyst
Company: Federal Office for Buildings and Logistics FOBL
Description:
L'Ufficio federale delle costruzioni e della logistica UFCL cerca un/a:

business e data analyst

80%-100% / Berna

Apprezza una collaborazione di successo?

Tramite l'analisi dei dati e un'ampia comprensione dei nessi immobiliari, contribuirà a sviluppare ulteriormente il nostro portafoglio immobiliare unico nel suo genere. Grazie alla sua capacità di lavorare in modo strategico e concettuale, potrà tradurre i requisiti interdisciplinari derivanti dalla gestione immobiliare e dal settore della sostenibilità in una gestione efficace dei dati. Nel nostro Ufficio avrà la possibilità di realizzare la sua passione per l'elaborazione e l'analisi dei dati a favore di una gestione sostenibile degli immobili.

Le Sue mansioni


Svolgere analisi di dati e modellazioni per riconoscere tendenze e modelli e illustrare previsioni di sviluppo
Acquisire ed elaborare dati e implementare le procedure di controllo della qualità
Valutare dati e fattori ambientali per promuovere la sostenibilità nel settore immobiliare e seguirne gli sviluppi
Fornire supporto allo sviluppo e all'attuazione di strategie aziendali attraverso conoscenze fondate sui dati e la loro visualizzazione
Dirigere progetti d'attuazione dal punto di vista tecnico, organizzativo e del personale


Il Suo profilo


Formazione di livello terziario (università, SUP) in informatica, data science, business analytics o informatica di gestione con esperienza o formazione continua nella gestione sostenibile degli immobili
Grande affinità con i sistemi digitali, capacità di operare in un'ottica economico-aziendale, metodo di lavoro analitico e concettuale
Esperienza professionale nell'analisi aziendale e dei dati nonché nell'ingegneria e nella gestione dei requisiti
Capacità di adattamento in un ambiente in costante evoluzione ed esperienza in diversi settori della gestione del cambiamento
Capacità di fissare priorità e promuovere compiti e progetti in modo efficiente
Buone conoscenze attive di due lingue ufficiali e dell'inglese


Informazioni complementari

Per Ulteriori Informazioni è a Disposizione

Signor Daniel Züger, capo Gestione degli immobili, tel. 058 465 31 28

Ulteriori informazioni sono disponibili sul nostro sito Internet , su LinkedIn e Instagram . La invitiamo a consultare la pagina che indica i vantaggi offerti dall'Amministrazione federale ai suoi collaboratori . #lavorareperlasvizzera

Si prega di candidarsi tramite il nostro sistema di gestione delle candidature. A tal fine, cliccare su «Per candidarsi».

Numero di riferimento: 620-11673

Chi siamo

L'UFCL è sinonimo di tradizione e modernità e conta circa 900 collaboratori di varie professioni. Sostenibile ed esemplare, l'Ufficio si impegna nei confronti delle prossime generazioni. L'individualità dei collaboratori e l'entusiasmo con cui si dedicano al proprio lavoro e alla definizione di nuovi standard fanno dell'UFCL uno degli Uffici federali più interessanti e polivalenti.

L'Amministrazione federale è attenta alle necessità e ai diversi vissuti dei suoi collaboratori e ne apprezza la diversità. La parità di trattamento gode della massima priorità.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our IoT Lab team, responsible for developing BOBST Connect, our all-in-one digital platform that enhances and improves packaging productivity. BOBST Connect brings data and digital services together in one fully connected cloud platform, with BOBST machine insights and expertise built-in, enabling overview and orchestration of the production process. You will be an integral part of the agile organization responsible for developing this innovative product, constantly evolving to serve our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with our business stakeholders, IoT product management team, development teams, and other Data Scientists to define new products, services, and tools using data and machine learning. As a member of the team, you will work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets. You will also be responsible for supporting the teams with data operational tasks.

Please note this is a hands-on role, involving a lot of data crunching: if you are looking for a management or supervisory position, this is not for you, as we strive to keep a flat hierarchy with very productive and operational teams.

Main Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy data-driven solutions to answer a variety of business problems (predictive maintenance, equipment lifecycle analysis, etc.)
Understand the requirements of product owners and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Design and implement data pipelines and data warehouses to support data analysis and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Mentor and coach developers on best practices in data analysis, modelling, and visualization.
Keep up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, and apply them to solve business problems.


Your Education And Languages Capabilities


Bachelor in Computer Science or Data Science (Master or PHD a plus)
Full professional proficiency in English. French an asset.


Your technical Knowledge


Advanced proficiency in programming languages (ideally Python), and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, or standard libraries (D3/Plotly/...).
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


At least 3 years in a similar role
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive (experience with Databricks is a big plus).
Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Microsoft Azure).
Experience with Agile/Scrum disciplines based on Azure DevOps


Your personal attributes


A true believer in the value of data, with the ability to take ownership and deliver autonomously and proactively tangible results to the organization.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including very senior managers.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to identify patterns and insights in large data sets.
Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure data accuracy and completeness, while keeping solutions as simple and robust as possible.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in an agile environment, including the ability to manage priorities and give regular reporting on ongoing tasks.
Continuous learning mindset, keeping up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world’s leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let’s shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.
Show more

Title: Consumer and Data Driven, Insight Analyst - Internship Program
Description:
Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland.

VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey aim to develop and boost future talents on their early career path. As we are in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy, and commitment of our people, you can expect a dedicated and structured learning path and hands-on experience.




About Vf

VF Corporation is one of the world’s largest apparel, footwear and accessories companies connecting people to the lifestyles, activities and experiences they cherish most through a family of iconic outdoor, active and workwear brands including Vans®, The North Face®, Timberland® and Dickies®. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling.




INTERNSHIP ROLE




We are looking for a Consumer and Data-Driven Insight Analyst to join the EMEA Strategy and CI Team within VF EMEA Internship Program.




KEY INTERNSHIP INFO

Start date: October 1st 2024.
For the first 6 months your salary will be 1600chf/month, while for the following 6 months it is 1900chf/month.
We cannot grant that internship will lead you to the permanent position, but thanks to the effective training 70% of interns are staying in the company after the internship period!




What You Will Learn

Ability to mine, analyse and leverage consumer and market data to address Business questions and help inform decisions
Work with different data sets to inform Business decisions i.e. know which data resource to leverage, learn different analysis approaches and techniques
Leverage data to generate insights
Visualize and present data in a clear manner
Develop an understanding of how to measure and impact marketing effectiveness and efficiency
Collaborate internally and externally with key partners to analyse and report the impact of marketing activities
Understand key marketing / media strategies to drive brand growth
Understand key tenants of digital marketing and media effectiveness and efficiency
Learn to use analytical problem solving to make better decisions
Learn priority-setting and planning
Learn to effectively collaborate and communicate with impact




How You Will Make a Difference

You will have a student status while beginning an internship or you have graduated already before in 2024 – it’s a must.
You are fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
You have curious mindset with passion for working with people.
You are eager to learn and face up new challenges.
First experience such as other internships, extracurricular activities, is considered as a plus.

What’s In It For You

Tailored 12-month development path.
An inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together.
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do.
Access to the gym and subsidized canteen in the office.
Up to 50% discounts on our brands.
Shuttle bus to the office or discount to public transport (dependent on your location).




ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!




R-20240722-0029

Show more

  • Learn to effectively collaborate and communicate with impact


How You Will Make a Difference

  • You will have a student status while beginning an internship or you have graduated already before in 2024 – it’s a must.
  • You are fluent in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • You have curious mindset with passion for working with people.
  • You are eager to learn and face up new challenges.
  • First experience such as other internships, extracurricular activities, is considered as a plus.

What’s In It For You

  • Tailored 12-month development path.
  • An inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together.
  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do.
  • Access to the gym and subsidized canteen in the office.
  • Up to 50% discounts on our brands.
  • Shuttle bus to the office or discount to public transport (dependent on your location).


ARE YOU IN? Apply now – early application increases your chances!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Notre mission :

Ivy Partners est une société de conseil Suisse qui contribue à l’évolution des entreprises dans leurs enjeux stratégiques, technologiques et organisationnels.

Notre objectif aujourd’hui est d’offrir à nos collaborateurs une carrière qui contribuera positivement à leur épanouissement et à leur bien-être, en les faisant monter en compétences et en leur offrant de réelles perspectives d’évolution.

En tant que Data Engineer chez IVY Partners, vous serez en charge de :

Gérer un important flux de données au sein du Data Warehouse
Compiler et traiter des données provenant de divers fournisseurs selon la logique métier.
Maintenir, optimiser et développer le Data Warehouse basé sur Snowflake.
Collaborer avec l'équipe technique pour assurer l'intégrité et la performance des données.
Participer à la création de rapports et de tableaux de bord pour les clients et prospects.




Profil :

Maîtrise indispensable de SQL pour la manipulation et gestion des données.
Expérience nécessaire avec Snowflake ou équivalent (ex : DataBricks, Denodo) sont acceptées.
Bonne compréhension de l'environnement cloud, en particulier AWS.
Connaissance essentielle avec Python
Connaissance de terraform souhaitée mais non obligatoire.
Capacité à monter en compétence et à s'adapter aux évolutions technologiques.
Attitude proactive et capacité à travailler en équipe.




🤝 Ivy, c’est aussi :

La bienveillance | Soucieux de nos employés, nous leur garantissons un environnement favorable où chacun est valorisé et se voit offrir des formations et des perspectives d’évolution en Suisse ou à l’international.

La confiance | Travailler avec nous, c’est développer un partenariat fondé sur la confiance, le professionnalisme et la transparence à chaque instant.

L’innovation | Nous garantissons une transformation numérique efficace grâce à l’innovation technologique couplée à la créativité.

La responsabilité | Le collectif est à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons, et nous prenons cette responsabilité au sérieux en mettant tout en œuvre pour avoir un impact positif.

🚀 Rejoindre Ivy, c’est prendre part à une aventure stimulante à chaque instant ! Merci d'envisager de nous rejoindre, nous sommes impatients d'en savoir plus sur vous !

Title: Junior Quantitative Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Workload: 100%

Are you passionate about quantitative analysis and IT? Join Axpo Solutions AG as a Junior Quantitative and IT Analyst. This role is perfect for someone with strong analytical skills and a keen interest in the energy sector, looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment.

What you will do:


Ensure integrity and security of data and systems.
Review the current infrastructure and propose improvements.
Ensure reporting of P&L and risk metrics.
Collaborate with MO and BO for setting up booking concepts for new products.
Work closely with other Short Term Quantitative Analysts.
Conduct backtesting of strategies and analyze performance.
Assist Short Term Analysts in developing new strategies.
Collaborate with Short Term Quantitative Analysts to ensure power optimization strategies are executed correctly to generate P&L and support ORI development.



What you bring & who you are:


Relevant academic background in a quantitative field.
Proficient in Python, C#, SQL, and database management.
Fluent in English; proficiency in French or German is a plus.
Strong analytical skills combined with a problem-solving attitude.
Ability to communicate complex technical topics clearly.
Knowledge of the energy business.
Comfortable with trading and finance concepts.



About the team:

Join a team of dedicated professionals in the Balancing & Short Term Optimization department. We foster a collaborative and innovative environment where every team member is valued and encouraged to contribute their unique skills and perspectives to drive our success.

Be part of a company that values continuous learning and development, and is committed to sustainability and innovation in the energy sector. Apply now to become a key player in our team and help shape the future of energy with Axpo Solutions AG.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Data Engineer to help drive business decisions by using the power of data. The Data Engineer will join the EMEA Business Analytics Team based in Cham, Switzerland. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building, developing and maintain the data infrastructure and pipeline for delivering advanced analytical solutions and data products. This role is critical for shaping our data strategy and supporting data-driven decision making across the organization.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with the data team to develop business intelligence (BI) data products, empowering and accelerating business processes
Set up and maintain infrastructure for data science use cases, including ELT pipelines, machine learning models, and app deployment, using various open-source tools. As part of this role, you’ll also act as a half-platform engineer
Work closely with BI, IT, and data engineering peers to identify optimal solutions on private cloud
Design, develop, and curate data pipelines to maintain reliable and well-curated data sources, enhancing productivity
Bring best practices to the entire lifecycle of data products, from development and testing to deployment and ongoing maintenance
Develop a deep understanding of data based on business acumen, collaborating closely with data scientists, business analysts, and business stakeholders
Communicate technical and business topics effectively, using written, verbal, and presentation materials as needed



What You'll Bring


Experience in creating data pipelines using SQL and Python, with a strong proficiency in both
Familiarity with Linux, Kubernetes, Airflow, and CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of best practices for database design within relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Vertica)
Experience with Mlflow and Kubeflow is a plus
Exposure to data products, including dashboards and machine learning models
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude, capable of finding solutions with minimal guidance
A team player with a growth mindset, possessing excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills. You’ll be able to deliver on tight deadlines in alignment with business requirements



, Tesla

Title: Expert(e) Data & BI / Qliksence
Description:
Expert(e) Data & BI- Secteur banque / finance




Stack technique: #Qliksense#SQL #Avaloq #Greenplum




Nous recherchons un ou une Expert(e) Data & BI- Secteur banque / finance pour rejoindre une notre client, une banque privée sur Genève ou Paris. Ce poste s'adresse à un profil confirmé /senior avec au moins 8 ans d'expérience, doté d'une solide capacité d'analyse et d'innovation.




🔓 Ce que nous offrons :

Un Projet Ambitieux : Participer à des projets de reporting BI avancés dans un environnement financier exigeant.
Processus de Recrutement Rapide : Chez Darwin Partners on sait que votre temps est précieux. Pas de perte de temps avec de multiples entretiens et tests techniques. Nous nous engageons à un processus de recrutement rapide et efficace.
Équipe de Haut Niveau : Rejoignez un groupe d'experts où l'excellence et l'innovation sont la norme.




🔎 Activités 🔎

Concevoir et mettre en place des solutions BI innovantes pour répondre aux besoins de l'entreprise.
Analyser les données et les modèles afin d'optimiser les performances.
Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données.
Participer activement à la mise en place de l'architecture BI
Développer et optimiser les processus ETL.
Analyser les besoins métiers et concevoir des modèles de données appropriés.
Concevoir des tableaux de bord et des visualisations de données avec Qliksense.
Assurer l'intégration des données provenant de diverses sources et garantir leur qualité.
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes techniques et métiers pour déployer des solutions BI adaptées.
Former les utilisateurs finaux à l'utilisation des outils BI et des tableaux de bord développés.







🎭Votre profil / compétences / qualités🎭




Maîtrise de Qliksense
Connaissance d'Avaloq est un atout
Reporting sur greeplum
Idéalement connaissances Dataops et Machine Learning
Connaissances en contrôle de Gestion / Finance
Expérience en ETL, intégration de données, et gestion de bases de données.
Compétences en modélisation de données et création de tableaux de bord interactifs.
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages de requête (SQL).
Bonne compréhension des processus métier et capacité à transformer des besoins en solutions BI efficaces.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à communiquer efficacement.
Autonomie et rigueur dans le travail.
Capacité d'adaptation et d'innovation face aux défis techniques.
Vous parlez Français et Anglais
Vous avez au moins 8 ans d'expérience




🛎️ Informations complémentaires🛎️




Poste basé à Genève ou Paris
Mission long terme

Title: Engineer-DATA-Pulse EUR (EMEA)
Description:
Position Overview

Responsibilities:


Involvement in data reconciliation
Support Finance in UAT testing
Work with Finance to create adjustments needed for the reporting
Check the unmapped items in the hierarchies and identify the required mappings
Support business and technical investigations and provide solutions for closing the identified issues



Technical skills:


Deep understanding of Banking products and MIS reporting
Deep understanding of products and processes for Wealth Management/Private Banking customers
Ability to understand easily requirements and to support reconciliations
Good knowledge of Excel
Good knowledge of database concepts and SQL queries
Good knowledge on BI tools like QlikSense is a plus



Soft skills:


Excellent communication and English skills
Can work under pressure and be delivery focused and pragmatic
Excellent team work with collaborative, innovative and intelligent problem solving
Analyze, troubleshoot, document
Self-motivated and proactive in identifying risks/differences



Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an Data Engineer to work on a project with our client based in Switzerland.




This role is a long term contracted position, with the option to extend. It is operated on a fully remote basis from Switzerland.




Responsibilities & Activities:

Create interactive visualizations and dashboards to communicate complex information clearly and concisely using as Power BI
Work with the data analyst team to understand information needs and design appropriate visualizations.
Use data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Einstein Analytics etc.)
Help automate data visualization processes through scripting and programming.
Transform, enrich, and prepare data for analysis and visualization in Dashboards.
Design, update, and control of daily and weekly reporting.
Present and communicate analysis results.
Support business stakeholders through data visualization and manage backlog of requests through an agile framework.
Focusing on AWS Data Lake, realtime pipelines, ETL and data activation.
Participate in the development of our AWS Data Lake/Data Mesh through different methods of data ingestion and using best AWS ETL tools AWS Glue, AWS Lambda , AWS Kubernetes , AWS crawlers
Play a pivotal role in the process of moving towards microservices and event-driven architecture
Be part of the Data organization, building and operating the core technologies that enable data scientists, analysts and the different business units to leverage rich data in efficient and innovative ways to generate impact and connect people to the most relevant real-world experiences.
Own and maintain critical data pipelines for our AWS Data lake and the resulting data products that are used daily across the company to inform all sorts of decisions and models.
Are an analytical and conceptual thinker, who thinks about Data architecture on a strategic level;
Implementing Data pipelines in an AWS Data lake through tools such as AWS Glue, AWS Lambda , AWS Kubernetes, Terraform




Requirements:

Excellent visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, typography, colour, interaction design and fluency with BI tools.
2+ years of professional experience designing interactive dashboards.
2+ years of software/data engineering experience
2+ years of professional experience designing big and scalable cloud data platforms - Data Streaming, Data Lake
Expertise in Python/, Spark, SQL, Terraform, Apache Spark, Docker and task orchestration tools (Airflow)
Expertise in AWS tools and concepts AWS Glue, AWS Lambda , AWS Kubernetes , AWS crawlers
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources
Expertise in Power BI or any other data visualization tool.




If you’re interested in discussing this opportunity in further detail then please feel free to submit an application via the job description, alternatively, email me on molham.kanawati@phaidoninternational.com with any questions.

Title: Business Analyst for Data Migration
Description:
Information and Document Systems is a global technology change and delivery organization comprising nearly 200 individuals located mostly in Switzerland, Poland and Singapore. Providing global capturing and document processing, archiving and retrieval solutions to all business divisions focusing on supporting Legal, Regulatory and Operational functions. At the moment developing strategic greenfield project to build large-scale digital archive for documents and records, that will gradually replace all existing archiving solutions in the bank, and to build an operational document store, that should become a single point of truth for document workflows. The whole system must scale linearly, be fault-tolerant, and handle petabytes of data.




Technologies used:

100% Scala using Functional Programming (FP),
Event Driven Architecture with Kafka as event store and Kafka Streams for event streaming,
Reactive streams for streaming data over HTTP: Akka HTTP/Streams,
Non-blocking concurrency: Akka, Monix,
FP abstractions: Cats,
Developed by several teams using Kanban




Responsibilities:

You will contribute to the design and documentation of business requirements, covering regulatory and legal archiving applications in addition to operational functionality to deliver end to end solutions to our stakeholders. The creation of the solution documentation strengthening of the systematic traceability from business request to application function is a vital part of the work. Teamwork and cross-discipline collaboration is essential.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Have 5+years' experience in business\system analysis, preferably in banking industry
Strong understanding of IT Technologies
Hands-on experience of working on a Migration (ETL) delivery
Excellent communication skills
Ability to form strong relationships with IT and Business
Have strong analytical skills
Object oriented design
Open minded and self-motivated
High level of competence in verbal and written English
Have very good understanding of business as well as technical language
Know Scrum framework and is ready to work that way




Nice-to-Have Skills Description:

Experience in the Archiving Domain
Experience of banking processes
Understanding of integration architecture
Create UML diagrams, data flow diagrams, ERD (diagrams




Languages:

English: B2 Upper Intermediate

Show more

  • Have 5+years' experience in business\system analysis, preferably in banking industry
  • Strong understanding of IT Technologies
  • Hands-on experience of working on a Migration (ETL) delivery
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to form strong relationships with IT and Business
  • Have strong analytical skills
  • Object oriented design
  • Open minded and self-motivated
  • High level of competence in verbal and written English
  • Have very good understanding of business as well as technical language
  • Know Scrum framework and is ready to work that way


Nice-to-Have Skills Description:

  • Experience in the Archiving Domain
  • Experience of banking processes
  • Understanding of integration architecture
  • Create UML diagrams, data flow diagrams, ERD (diagrams


Languages:

  • English: B2 Upper Intermediate

Title: Data / Analytics Engineer (EMEA Remote)
Description:
ANYbotics is a fast-growing tech company dedicated to shaping the future of mobile robotics across multiple industries. Join our highly talented and motivated team of more than 130 people and work on cutting-edge robot technology. The Opportunity ANYbotics is a leading robotics company specializing in advanced autonomous systems. With a successful Series B financing round recently closed, we are poised for rapid growth and international expansion. Our mission is to revolutionize the robotics industry through cutting-edge technology and innovation. As we embark on this exciting journey, we are seeking a dynamic, experienced and versatile Data & Analytics Engineer to join our #Ateam (Remotely) and help us shape the Future of Robotics. As Data & Analytics Engineer you are responsible for designing, developing and maintaining our BI Data Platform. This combined role will involve both Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering responsibilities to ensure a seamless process for centralizing business data from various sources and turning it into trusted analytics-ready data to serve business end users. The role is a crucial position as ANYbotics is committed to strengthen data-driven decision making. The role gives you the unique opportunity to work with the Director Business Intelligence to shape and deploy ANYbotics’ data and BI infrastructure to drive better business decisions and empower stakeholders to understand their business and customers in new ways. The Market & Our Technology ANYbotics transforms the industrial sector by introducing robotics to a wide range of novel applications that so far were beyond reach (see our case studies in Chemicals, Oil & Gas, Railways, Wind Energy, Mining, Construction). Our customers are large asset operators and service providers of industrial plants pioneering robotics technology for inspection and maintenance. Our solution enables autonomous routine inspections and monitoring of large-scale industrial facilities for increased safety and productivity. We develop numerous customized hardware systems, including the entire robotic platform, actuators, sensors, inspection payloads, charging systems, and software to achieve world-class mobility, autonomy, and inspection capabilities, often based on AI. We have proven the technology and the business impact on our customers in long-term pilot projects. We are now scaling the commercialization of our solution(s) and deploying directly into operation at customer facilities worldwide. Your Contributions


Build up and maintain a company-wide BI Data Platform (including integration of relevant source data)
Work closely with business and tool owners to understand data generating processes and convert raw business data into trusted and validated analytics-ready data sets
Design and implement data models, build data pipelines, and leverage SQL queries for clean, tested, documented and well-defined data data marts
Act as the technical expert to decide and build the best data extraction, storage, transformation and scheduling methods for different business use cases and data sources
Enforce data governance policies to maintain data integrity, security and quality



Your Profile


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field of study
Proven experience (3+ years) in a data engineering / analytics engineering role, including a track record in building a BI Data Platform
Expertise in SQL and experience with dbt
Hands-on experience implementing ETL/ELT processes
Strong programming skills in Python
Experience with cloud based data warehouses (ex. Snowflake, Redshift) and ETL/ELT tools (ex. Fivetran, Tray)
Experience with working with APIs to extract data from a variety of data sources
Can-do attitude and a very open and engaging personality with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders
Independent self-starter with well-structured ways of working
Experience with the modern data stack tools is a big plus
Ability to work with cloud platforms (ex. AWS) is a plus
Knowledge and experience with application of software engineering best practices to analytics code (ex. version control, CI/CD) is a plus
Bonus: Experience in a fast-growing high tech industrial company environment



We offer you a very exciting and dynamic work environment, the opportunity to become part of a fast-growing company and an ambitious team that is on a mission to change the industrial inspection market, a chance to leverage your experience and bring in your own ideas, a fair market salary, an attractive employee stock ownership plan, and a job in the city of Zurich.
Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Data Centre Engineer (Connectivity & Hardware Support)




Location: Zurich, Switzerland

Salary: 75,000 – 95,000 CHF (£65,000 - £82,000)

Employment: Full Time/ Permanent




We’re recruiting for Engineers to work within a team carrying out cabling infrastructure and network hardware support at client customer sites. The work will include all types of patching, break-fix, circuit provision and recovery, disconnect/reconnect of desktop and networking equipment, rack and stack of Data Centre Hardware (eg Server, Network and Storage) and provision of connectivity to DC Hardware. The position will be site based as required and reports to the Service Delivery Manager.

For this role candidates will need to:

Be able to work on multiple client sites across allocated regions.
Be available for out of hours working, being part of an on-call rota to include weekends and evenings as business demands.
Work the following hours: Monday to Friday a mixture of shifts including 07:00 - 16:00 and 12:00 - 21:00 (Shift Rota) - Weekday overtime and Weekend working as required.




Responsibilities of our Connectivity & Hardware Support Engineers will include:

Monitor the client’s ticket system and ensure tickets are assigned and completed within SLA.
Audit and document existing cabling installations.
Audit and document desktop configuration, including patching and power, for existing and proposed user locations.
Compile patching schedules as required.
Utilise Cable Management Software as required for patching planning.
Power down and disconnect all desktop equipment including any peripherals ensuring all identified and labelled correctly ready for reconnection.
IMAC-D of all desktop equipment including any peripherals
Carry Out Data Wiping activities by use of Software tools.
Carry out all types of patching / jumpering including all types of voice & data, copper & fibre.
Carry out testing and fault finding on Copper and Fibre Cabling Infrastructure (including ISDN Line Tests) using a variety of modern testers to include continuity testers, tone generators and modern cabling standards testers.
Carry out all types of Copper Voice and Data terminations as required by the clients portfolio of cabling systems.
Maintain accurate records of all stock delivered and update as stock is used and advise line manager of any requirements, shortfalls.
Carry out surveys and update drawings and schedules.
Install and test analogue, digital and VOIP telephone handsets and provide headset support as required.
Build, Rack and Stack Network and Server hardware in Data Centre Halls and provide connectivity.
Perform Network Hardware break-fix activities e.g. replacing power supplies, modules, fans etc.




What we’re looking for in our Connectivity & Hardware Support Engineers:

Experience of working in Voice and Data Cabling environment
Experience of Moves Adds and Changes environment
Thorough understanding of modern computer network infrastructure
Thorough understanding and practical experience of fibre and copper voice and data cabling including terminating, test equipment, test parameters and test techniques
Knowledge of Rack and Stack of Server Hardware and Rack and Stack Systems
Good knowledge of Service Now (and other Process and Asset Management Tools)
Good knowledge of Server Patching
Knowledge of LAN / WAN and Active devices
Able to use all types of Modern Hand Held Cable Standards Testers
Able to use light Source and Power Meter

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
lastminute.com is the European Travel Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. It operates a portfolio of well-known brands such as lastminute.com, Volagratis, Rumbo, weg.de, Bravofly, Jetcost and Hotelscan.

Our mission is to lead the travel industry by leveraging technology to simplify, personalise, and enhance our customers’ travel experience. Experts in brightening up online travel, we help our customers find and do "whatever makes them pink".

We continuously invest in talented people who ensure our offering is closer to the needs of the customers and keep us at the cutting edge of technology evolution. More than 1,700 employees spread across our offices worldwide develop our own products and services to power the entire traveller journey for millions of people.

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

lastminute.com N.V. is a publicly-traded company listed under the ticker symbol LMN on the SIX Swiss Exchange.



Job Description



Job Description

Lastminute.com is looking for a Data Engineer for its Payments, Analysis and Reporting team. He/she will construct, develop, optimise and maintain complex data structures.

Key Responsibilities

Data Ingestion from fraud/payment providers

ETL & Reporting tool usage for Analysis and Report creation

Internal support on reporting and result's analysis

Support on key KPI's creation and elaboration through data extraction

Management, as unique Payment Operation interface, of the relation with DWH & BI & Product Developer



Qualifications



Essentials

at least 2 years of experience in similar roles

Very good SQL

Advanced Excel knowledge

Programming skills (Python, VBA or similar)

Desirable

Vertica (big data)

Tibco Spotfire (reporting)

Talend (ETL)

Linux

Html



Additional Information



What we offer

By joining our company, you will have the chance to:

Join a dynamic team in an inclusive-international environment
Grow thanks to the career journey and our internal mobility perspective
Manage your own schedule thanks to the flexible start and end of the working day
Work a shorter working week (36h), of which 4 hours on Friday morning
Get focus time for learning, development and deep work on Friday mornings
Work partially or fully remote according to local laws
Enjoy continuous training thanks to our company platform
Benefit from employee discounts on travel
Receive 2 days off per year for the purpose of volunteering
Welfare platform (Corporate Benefits) where you will find dedicated discounts with more than 1500 partners

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant
Description:
The Opportunity




We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Digital Analytics Consultant (all genders) to join our team. In this role, you will support the analysis and optimization of our clients' digital marketing efforts through the use of various analytics tools and methodologies. You will work closely with senior consultants and other team members to deliver actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making.




The Position

As a new Digital Analytics Consultant (all genders) within our team, you’ll spend your time:

Collecting, processing, and analysing digital data from multiple sources, including websites, social media, and advertising platforms.
Developing and maintaining regular performance reports and dashboards to monitor key metrics.
Supporting the implementation and configuration of analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and others.
Assisting with the setup and management of web tracking through Adobe Launch and other tag management systems.
Conducting detailed analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in digital marketing campaigns.
Collaborating with internal teams and clients to define measurement strategies and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Presenting findings and recommendations to clients and internal stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
Staying up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in digital analytics and marketing.




Qualifications:

Digital Analytics Consultant Essentials:

You hold a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Informatics, Statistics, or a related field.
You have a basic understanding of digital marketing concepts and analytics methodologies.
You possess experience with web analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.
You are familiar with Adobe Launch, Google Tag Manager or other tag management systems.
You have experience with web tracking implementation and troubleshooting.
You are proficient in JavaScript and HTML.
You have proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
You have the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
You are eager to learn and grow in the field of digital analytics.
You are fluent in German (a must-have).




What you can expect from us

Discover our Swiss benefits here.

Apart from the country specific benefits listed, we have more to offer. Our growth development program, for example, to help you excel in your existing profession, or enable you to explore another. Also, there are plenty of internal initiatives for you to take part in. Whether it's about improving Valtech as a business or contributing to the world around us, we encourage our employees to pursue their professional and personal ambitions.




About the Valtech Switzerland

You will join our international Swiss team made up of 100+ people, 30+ different nationalities and many mother tongues. Here at Valtech our jobs wrap around our lives – not the other way around. Whether you’d like to work part-time or from home, we make sure to find a work model that fits your lifestyle. Furthermore we understand that the right equipment is essential to do great work. When joining us you have the opportunity to select the brand you feel most comfortable with and we will make sure you have everything you need.

At work honesty, openness and respect reflect our core values and we encourage an open feedback culture in order to build trust and grow together. Outside of working time we offer plenty of optional downtime activities such as Ski trips, wine tasting or cooking classes to get to know your colleagues.




Valtech as an Equitable and Inclusive Employer

At Valtech, we’re here to engineer experiences that work and reach every single person. To do this, we are proactive about creating workplaces that work for every person at Valtech. Our goal is to create an equitable workplace which gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow and meet their goals (whatever they may be). You can find out more about what we’re doing to create a Valtech for everyone https://www.valtech.com/about/diversity-inclusion/.

Please do not worry if you do not meet all of the criteria or if you have some gaps in your CV. We’d love to hear from you and see if you’re our next member of the Valtech team

Title: Paid Internship – Consumer & Market Knowledge: Analytics (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Position: Paid Internship – Consumer & Market Knowledge: Analytics (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Are you energized by solving tough business problems? Are you curious and creative with a bias towards action? If so, then a role in the Analytics & Insights organization is for you!

The Analytics & Insights organization create a point of difference for P&G. We directly influence business strategy, via deep consumer, retailer and market understanding, spanning from human insights to data science.

This role is within Analytics. You will be the broader A&I organization go-to-person on data analysis and big data application, with your deep understanding of and passion for data analysis, striking the tangent between consumer insights and advanced analytics to solve tough business problems as a strategic consultant to P&G leadership.

Key Responsibilities


We deliver insights by using analytics techniques. This includes us enabling teams to assess business potential of new ideas and launch successful initiatives, or us quantifying key business drivers and assessing sufficiency of plans to meet targets according to our models.
We also visually and intuitively marry consumer insights with data, for compelling and holistic business recommendations.


Skills/Qualifications

Job Qualifications


BA or MSc student. Typical areas of study include: Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Physical Sciences or Quantitative Social Sciences, but so long as you otherwise recognize yourself in and feel passion for this type of challenge, we would love to hear from you;
Strong analytical skills and an analytical problem solver;
Can then tell the story that explains the discovery, excite the audience and turn recommendations into reality;
Has exceptional written, visual and verbal communication skills;
A leader: you envision how things can get better, set the direction, enroll others to get there and energize others until your vision becomes reality;
Values simplicity and sets priorities, there are only so many hours in a day and your friends and family deserve some of it;
Has an entrepreneur mind-set, while technically (data) savvy: you prefer to chart your own course to get the job done;
Is creative; finds that unique viewpoint to solve problems;
Has the ability to contribute and influence across levels and functions;
Is able and willing to travel;
For local market roles, related language skills may be required.


You probably have an even better chance if you have:


Experience with Statistical Packages, e.g. SQL, Python, R, Matlab, SPSS, SAS and/or JMP;
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools such as Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau etc.


What’s In It For You


Experience the real corporate environment. Our internships give students an intensive immersion in a dynamic, international, diverse and flexible work environment.
Be a project leader. Interns are entrusted with a live business project to lead, own and perform as of the first day.
Most exciting of all: is that a successful completion of the internship may lead to a permanent position in our Organization.
Competitive compensation
Housing support: we provide you with a furbished accommodation in Geneva at a convenient rate, co-located with many other interns/new hires (applicable only if you currently live >75km from Geneva).
Round trip ticket to Geneva, subsidized meals in our canteen, free public transport in Geneva, on-site gym, company store, on-site hair salon, sports teams and “new-hire network” are among the many benefits.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability or any other legally protected factor. We value flexibility and life balance and we have tools and policies ensuring our people feel part of an inclusive community.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with non – EU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000091834

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Position: Paid Internship – Consumer & Market Knowledge: Analytics (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Are you energized by solving tough business problems? Are you curious and creative with a bias towards action? If so, then a role in the Analytics & Insights organization is for you!

The Analytics & Insights organization create a point of difference for P&G. We directly influence business strategy, via deep consumer, retailer and market understanding, spanning from human insights to data science.

This role is within Analytics. You will be the broader A&I organization go-to-person on data analysis and big data application, with your deep understanding of and passion for data analysis, striking the tangent between consumer insights and advanced analytics to solve tough business problems as a strategic consultant to P&G leadership.

Key Responsibilities

  • We deliver insights by using analytics techniques. This includes us enabling teams to assess business potential of new ideas and launch successful initiatives, or us quantifying key business drivers and assessing sufficiency of plans to meet targets according to our models.
  • We also visually and intuitively marry consumer insights with data, for compelling and holistic business recommendations.

Skills/Qualifications

Job Qualifications

  • BA or MSc student. Typical areas of study include: Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Physical Sciences or Quantitative Social Sciences, but so long as you otherwise recognize yourself in and feel passion for this type of challenge, we would love to hear from you;
  • Strong analytical skills and an analytical problem solver;
  • Can then tell the story that explains the discovery, excite the audience and turn recommendations into reality;
  • Has exceptional written, visual and verbal communication skills;
  • A leader: you envision how things can get better, set the direction, enroll others to get there and energize others until your vision becomes reality;
  • Values simplicity and sets priorities, there are only so many hours in a day and your friends and family deserve some of it;
  • Has an entrepreneur mind-set, while technically (data) savvy: you prefer to chart your own course to get the job done;
  • Is creative; finds that unique viewpoint to solve problems;
  • Has the ability to contribute and influence across levels and functions;
  • Is able and willing to travel;
  • For local market roles, related language skills may be required.

You probably have an even better chance if you have:

  • Experience with Statistical Packages, e.g. SQL, Python, R, Matlab, SPSS, SAS and/or JMP;
  • Experience with Business Intelligence Tools such as Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau etc.

What’s In It For You

  • Experience the real corporate environment. Our internships give students an intensive immersion in a dynamic, international, diverse and flexible work environment.
  • Be a project leader. Interns are entrusted with a live business project to lead, own and perform as of the first day.
  • Most exciting of all: is that a successful completion of the internship may lead to a permanent position in our Organization.
  • Competitive compensation
  • Housing support: we provide you with a furbished accommodation in Geneva at a convenient rate, co-located with many other interns/new hires (applicable only if you currently live >75km from Geneva).
  • Round trip ticket to Geneva, subsidized meals in our canteen, free public transport in Geneva, on-site gym, company store, on-site hair salon, sports teams and “new-hire network” are among the many benefits.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability or any other legally protected factor. We value flexibility and life balance and we have tools and policies ensuring our people feel part of an inclusive community.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with non – EU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000091834

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Overview:

We are looking for skilled Data Centre Engineers to join our team, responsible for delivering cabling infrastructure and supporting network hardware at client locations. This role involves diverse tasks, including setting up connections, troubleshooting hardware, installing and configuring servers and network equipment, and ensuring all systems are operational. This is a field-based position with direct reporting to the Service Operations Manager.




Key Responsibilities:

Ticket Management: Monitor and respond to support requests and incidents through the client’s ticketing system, ensuring timely resolution according to service level agreements (SLAs).
Cabling and Network Setup: Perform detailed surveys and documentation of existing network setups, including cabling layouts, patching configurations, and power arrangements for user workspaces.
Hardware Installation and Configuration: Install, configure, and test data centre hardware including servers, network devices, and storage systems, ensuring all equipment is correctly connected and operational.
Equipment Maintenance and Troubleshooting: Conduct routine maintenance and break-fix support for network and server equipment, including replacing faulty components like power supplies and network cards.
Data Security and Equipment Handling: Ensure secure data handling by conducting data wiping procedures and maintaining accurate records of hardware installations, movements, and changes.
Patching and Cable Management: Implement and maintain patching schedules and plans, managing all types of connections such as voice, data, copper, and fibre optics to ensure robust network performance.
Testing and Diagnostics: Use advanced testing tools to perform network diagnostics, identifying and resolving faults in cabling and network hardware efficiently.
Documentation and Compliance: Maintain detailed and accurate documentation of all network configurations, changes, and installations, ensuring compliance with company and client standards.
Client Coordination: Work closely with clients to understand their requirements and provide support for network setups, equipment relocations, and infrastructure changes.




Skills and Qualifications:

Technical Expertise: Extensive experience in data centre environments with a strong understanding of network and server infrastructure, including LAN/WAN setups, and cabling systems.
Hands-on Experience: Proficient in installing and maintaining both copper and fibre optic cabling, including termination, testing, and fault diagnostics.
Equipment Knowledge: Familiarity with various network and server hardware, including racking and stacking, hardware configuration, and connectivity provisioning.
Tool Proficiency: Competent in using modern network testing tools and equipment to perform diagnostics and ensure system performance.
Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex hardware and network issues promptly to minimize downtime.
Flexibility and Adaptability: Willingness to work across multiple sites, adapt to different working conditions, and participate in an on-call rotation for after-hours support.




Working Conditions:

This role requires frequent travel to different client sites within the region.
Engineers must be available for out-of-hours work, including nights and weekends, as part of an on-call schedule.
Standard working hours are on a rotating shift basis, with flexibility to accommodate business needs and occasional overtime.

Title: Business Analyst - Data Management - Fintech
Description:
Immediate start in a dynamic banking environment.|Opportunity to engage in technical innovation within the financial sector.


About Our Client

Our client is a leading bank located in Geneva, renowned for its commitment to technical innovation and excellence in financial services. The client offers a forward-thinking environment where technology and finance intersect to create cutting-edge solutions.

Job Description


Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams.
Analyze and document business requirements related to data management, data mesh, and data distribution.
Develop and implement strategies for data management within the banking environment.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance with regulatory standards.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive technical solutions.
Provide expertise in data-related initiatives and projects.
Monitor and report on project progress, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Conduct thorough testing and validation of technical solutions.


The Successful Applicant


Proven experience as a Technical Business Analyst in the financial sector.
Strong understanding of data management, data mesh, and data distribution.
A previous experience in a banking environment is mandatory.
It is mandatory to know SQL.
Fluency in both English and French is mandatory.
Swiss residency is required at the beginning of the mission.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders.


What's On Offer


An immediate start, allowing you to quickly integrate and contribute.
A stimulating environment that values technical innovation.
Competitive remuneration and benefits.
The opportunity to work on significant projects within the financial sector.


Contact: Aurélien Monchambert

Quote job ref: JN-072024-6469974

Title: Analista de Dados Jr. São Paulo - SP e Híbrido Efetivo
Description:
Descrição da vaga

A Método Engenharia é uma das empresas mais admiradas e sólidas dentro do seu setor de atuação, nosso propósito é construir o futuro realizando sonhos com soluções inteligentes!

Você fará parte do time de Planjejamento Financeiro.

Se você tem comprometimento, é obstinado e aberto na busca de novas tecnologias e inovação, dinâmico (a), analítico(a), comunicativo(a), tem habilidade de relacionamento interpessoal e quer fazer parte de uma das empresas mais admiradas do ramo, vem ser Método!

Responsabilidades e atribuições


Desenvolver relatórios gerenciais (Power BI);
Construção e manutenção de Dashboards;
Garantir a qualidade dos dados, das integrações e a consistência de relatório;
Preparar o material para a apresentação à Diretoria;
Acompanhar os resultados e oferecer informações para as áreas de negócios;
Colaborar com diferentes departamentos para entender suas necessidades de dados e fornecer soluções eficazes;
Contribuir para a melhoria contínua dos processos de coleta, processamento e análise de dados;
Manter documentação detalhada dos processos e metodologias utilizadas nas análises;
Realizar análises descritivas para identificar padrões e tendências básicas nos dados.


Requisitos e qualificações

Requisitos Da Vaga


Ensino superior completo em Tecnologia da Informação, Engenharias, Matemática, Estatística e correlatadas;
Desejável experiência a partir de 02 anos em posições similares;
Domínio em ferramentas de analytics; Excel, SQL, Python, Power BI, etc;
Conhecimento em linguagens de programação para extração e manuseio de dados.


Diferencial


Desejável pós-graduação em Big Data.


Informações adicionais

🍝 Cartão Swile - Benefício Flexível

🏥 Assistência Médica – Sulamérica (Titular e Dependentes)

🦷 Assistência Odontológica – Inpao (Titular e Dependentes)

🚌 Vale Transporte

🧡 Seguro de Vida

💪🏻 Total Pass

🥳 Day off no mês do seu aniversário

🏠 Modelo de trabalho híbrido

🖱️ Equipamentos necessários para realizar seu trabalho

👶 Licença Maternidade e Paternidade

🎓 Parcerias com Instituições de Ensino

Na Método Engenharia, trabalhamos para promover uma cultura inclusiva. Portanto, todas as nossas vagas são aplicáveis para todas as pessoas sem qualquer tipo de distinção. #somostodosMétodo 🧡

Title: Analista de Dados Pleno
HTML:
A SulAmérica há mais de 128 anos se dedica a entregar Saúde Integral para mais de 7 milhões de clientes por meio de produtos e serviços de Saúde, Odonto, Vida, Previdência e Investimentos. Temos como missão melhorar a vida das pessoas, oferecendo apoio, segurança e autonomia em cada momento e decisão de saúde física, emocional e financeira. Para isso, contamos com mais de 4 mil colaboradores(as) engajados(as) e comprometidos(as). Acreditamos que por meio da inclusão e da diversidade construímos um ambiente seguro e de pertencimento que valoriza e respeita as pessoas integralmente. Assim, incentivamos a candidatura de pessoas com deficiência, de diferentes raças e etnias, gêneros, orientações sexuais, identidades de gênero e gerações para todas as nossas vagas.


Analista de Dados Pleno


Elaboração de banco de dados com informação das emissões de crédito;

Desenvolvimento de Dashs em softwares de análise de dados;

Automatização de processos feitos em planilha;


Pré requisitos:

Formação superior em engenharia, ciência da computação ou áreas relacionadas;

Necessário habilidades em programação em Python e/ou SQL;

Conhecimento de softwares de análise de dados (Tableau, Power BI, Locker Studio, outros)


Modelo de trabalho:

3 vezes por semana no nosso escritório localizado na região da Av. Pres. Juscelino Kubitschek e 2 dias em home office.


O que a SulA vai te proporcionar?

Além de um ambiente de inovação e aberto a experimentação:

Salário competitivo com o mercado;

Vale Refeição e Alimentação - para matar aquela fome;

Assistência Média e Odontológica (extensível a dependentes) - Claro, da SulAmérica né!

Seguro de vida;

Auxílio Creche para papais e mamães;

Previdência Privada com uma ajudinha da SulA;

Seguro de Vida.

A SulAmérica é uma empresa em transformação, com DNA inovador e sempre preocupada em atender as necessidades dos seus clientes com soluções e produtos encantadores. Se identificou? Então vem com a gente e fazer parte desse time #sanguelaranja 🧡🚀

Title: Analista de Dados de Controladoria
HTML:
Você conhece a Laticínios Catupiry?

Somos o requeijão #1 do Brasil, sabor que conecta! Só Catupiry é Catupiry! Você irá fazer parte de um time que busca cada vez mais inovação, agilidade e desenvolvimento. Venha fazer parte do nosso time!

Como você irá contribuir com nosso time?

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Manutenção e atualização dos bancos de dados, desenvolvimento alinhado a TI de nossas bases de dados, alinhamento de conceitos e dimensões;
  • Supervisionar a migração de dados ou verificar a troca precisa de informações entre bancos de dados ou sistemas;
  • Atualização de sistema, rotinas administrativas;
  • Criação de comandos SQL para atualização, inclusão e criação de novas tabelas no VBA, Acces, MySQL, Beaver;
  • Melhorias na base de dados no e para Qlik View e Power Platform;
  • Criação das rotinas (Python e Power Query);
  • Atualização das ferramentas de consulta com base no Access, gerando relatórios para consulta dos processos;
  • Automatização dos Relatórios Gerencias da Area, vinculando as consultas aos bancos de dados através de Power Query, tanto na rede quanto na nuvem;
  • Automação do fechamento do P&L Gerencial, a partir das informações Contábeis, evidenciando as variações e diferenças;
  • Desenvolvimento de soluções para facilitar as rotinas de trabalho (Kaizen);
  • Criar modelagem de acompanhamento do negócio, via fórum de RGM envolvendo informações de estudo de mercado e margens;
  • Desenvolver modelo automatizado junto ao processo de Estudo e Lançamentos de Produtos.


Requisitos e qualificações

  • Ensino Superior Completo (Engenharia, Matemática e/ou Estatística, Ciência da Computação, Economia);
  • Conhecimentos avançados em SQL, Qlickview e Qlick Sense, Power BI e Excel/VBA;
  • Conhecimento em Protheus;
  • Vivência no conhecimento de programação, banco de dados;
  • Preferencialmente ter familiaridade em nosso Segmento ou atuação nos setores de Alimentos e Bebidas, Varejo;
  • Habilidade em diagnóstico de dados e apresentação de relatórios pra alta gestão;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de estratégias de negócios;
  • Conhecimento avançado em estatística.


Informações adicionais

Vaga para trabalhar no modelo Híbrido, Seg a Sex, 3x no escritório no Bom Retiro/SP e 2x Home Office;

Benefícios:

  • Assistência Médica
  • Assistência Odontológica
  • Vale Refeição
  • Vale Alimentação
  • Seguro de Vida
  • Convênio Farmácia
  • Universidade Corporativa
  • Plano de Carreira
  • Day off no mês do Aniversário
  • Descontos nos produtos Catupiry em nosso Empório
  • Ginástica laboral no escritório

Title: Analista de Experiência do Cliente Pl. - Dados
Description:
Somos o PAN

Ágeis, flexíveis e criativos, exploramos possibilidades com disposição e desejo de fazer acontecer. Sempre prontos para encarar novos desafios, nutrimos líderes que, além de ter garra, são abertos e empáticos, veem na proximidade das relações, o elo entre cada um.

Nossa missão, se faz cumprida quando transformamos a vida dos outros através dos nossos conhecimentos. Nossos pilares de cultura, reforçam nossa postura idealizadora e com desejo de fazer acontecer: T rabalho em equipe, O usadia empreendedora e P rotagonismo com profundidade.

Dominamos nossos processos e trazemos melhorias para quem deseja ter uma vida financeira mais inteligente.

Principais desafios:


Irá atuar com análise exploratória dos dados com objetivo identificar oportunidades na jornada do cliente;
Responsável por construir e dar manutenção nos dashes de data view e acompanhamento dos principais indicadores relacionados à jornada do cliente no banco (NPS, stickiness e etc);
Capacidade técnica e analítica para gerar indicadores e analisa-los contribuindo com sugestões para a estratégia do negócio;
Apresentação das análises realizadas e dos insights coletados no monitoramento dos KPIs;
Acompanhar os indicadores de sucesso.


Quais as principais competências para a posição?


Ter conhecimento em SQL básico (preferível nível intermediário) para extração e análise de dados (obrigatório);
Conhecimentos em data visualization (Tableau, Quicksight, Looker e etc);
Pacote Office (obrigatório);
Habilidade analítica, para explorar os dados e identificar oportunidades; (Obrigatório);
Atitude colaborativa, organização e vontade de fazer acontecer.


Modelo de atuação: Híbrido (4 dias presencial no escritório e 1 dia de home office)

Benefícios do PAN:


Bônus / PLR 🤑
Vale Refeição 🍔
Vale Alimentação 🍝
13º de Vale Alimentação 🤌
Convênio Médico (internação em apartamento para titular e dependentes) 🏥
Convênio Odonto/Ortodôntico 😁
Ambulatório Médico no escritório 🚑
Telemedicina Dr. Alper (Einstein Conecta) ilimitado. 🩺
Seguro de Vida ❤
Descontos em mais de 10 mil farmácias 💊
4 Sessões de psicoterapia por mês 🤝
Licença familiar estendida (Responsável 6 meses e corresponsável 30 dias) 👨‍🍼🤱
Auxílio Creche / Babá 🎒
AcomPANha (programa de acompanhamento para gestantes) 🫃🤰
Gympass/Totalpass 💪
Auxílio tecnologia assistivas (reembolso de 85% para colaboradores com deficiência) 🦻🦽
Day Off Aniversário 🎉
Day Off Tempo de Casa 🕛
Programa de reconhecimento por tempo de casa 🏆
Programas de desenvolvimento 📚
Gamificação em certificações e desenvolvimento (BitPANs) 🎫
Massagem e Auriculoterapia 💆‍♀️💆‍♂️
Salão de beleza no escritório 💇‍♂️💅
PAE (Orientação Jurídica, Financeira, Psicológica e Social) 🧑‍🎓
Serviço Social 🤗
Portal de descontos em diversos segmentos (Allya) 🤑
Campanha de vacinação (colaborador e dependente) 💉
Facilitação no financiamento de veículos 🚗
Cartão de crédito PAN com limite diferenciado 💳
Vale Transporte (desconto de apenas 4%) 🚆
Assistência Funeral 🤍


Assim como todas as nossas vagas, essa também é destinada à diversidade e inclusão. Independentemente de qualquer fator, perfil ou característica, Expanda sua carreira no PAN !

Para conhecer mais sobre nossos benefícios e cultura, acesse o Trabalhe Conosco:

https://www.bancopan.com.br/trabalhe-conosco/

Acesse também nossa página na Glassdoor e veja nossas avaliações:

https://www.glassdoor.com.br/Vis%C3%A3o-geral/Trabalhar-na-Banco-PAN-EI_IE1184444.13,22.ht

Title: Finanças | Analista em Ciência de Dados
Description:
Job Description

Somos mais que uma máquina, somos pessoas que transformam e criam infinitas possibilidades.

Trabalhamos para simplificar e impulsionar negócios para todas as pessoas, oferecendo soluções financeiras inteligentes. Aqui, investimos em tecnologia, promovemos desenvolvimento e fomentamos a inovação para criar novos caminhos possíveis e gerar impacto positivo no mundo.

Na Cielo, a gente trabalha com autonomia para escrever nossa própria jornada, liberdade para ser quem a gente é, e a oportunidade de fazer acontecer. Somos um time que sonha no plural, oferecendo uma experiência completa e focando no bem-estar físico e mental de nossos mais de 6.000 colaboradores e suas famílias.

Acreditamos na inclusão e acolhimento de todas as pessoas, com suas singularidades e diversidade de vivências.

Bora realizar seus sonhos com a gente!

Juntos com você, em infinitas possibilidades.

Responsibilities and assignments

Tem Lugar Para Você Nesse Propósito


Realizar a manutenção de dashboards e reports de monitoração do desempenho operacional e financeiro, visando geração de insights para a atuação da alta gestão
Apoiar na identificação de oportunidades de rentabilização da companhia por meio da exploração e modelagem de grande massa de dados
Participar do processo de limpeza, preparação e transformação de dados de diferentes fontes, garantindo a consistência e precisão das informações nas análises
Auxiliar na evolução e adaptação das visões apresentadas, considerando novos insights e resultados
Atuar em problemas complexos ou multifuncionais, propondo e aplicando abordagens customizadas
Responsabilizar-se pelas próprias entregas, com excelente nível de qualidade e prazo.



Requirements And Qualifications

O que o #TimeCielo espera de você?


Superior Completo: Ciência da Computação, Engenharia da Computação, Data Science ou áreas afins
Domínio de linguagens de programação (SQL, Python)
Experiência em criação de dashboards (Power BI) e reports focados na geração de insights para aumento do resultado da área
Conhecimento avançado em AWS, Excel e Powerpoint
Alta capacidade analítica, atenção a detalhes e comprovadas habilidades em modelagem financeira
Senso de priorização aguçado e forte capacidade de organização e planejamento.



Additional information

Por que viver infinitas possibilidades ao nosso lado?


Assistência Médica e Odontológica
Remuneração Variável Anual (PPR)
Auxílio Refeição e Alimentação
Auxílio Transporte, Fretado ou Estacionamento
Auxílio Trabalho Remoto
Seguro de Vida
Previdência Privada
Canal de apoio à especialistas (nutrição, psicologia, ginecologia etc)
Campanha de Vacinação
Edupass (Plataforma de estudo e desconto em instituições parceiras)
Gympass (Auxílio Academia e Bem-estar)
Programa de Gestação Saudável
Licença Maternidade e Paternidade estendida
Auxílio Creche
Dress Code Flexível
Horário Flexível
Sexta-curta
Almoço estendido (1h30).



Process stages


Step 1: Registration1Registration
Step 2: Triagem2Triagem
Step 3: Entrevista RH3Entrevista RH
Step 4: Entrevista Gestor4Entrevista Gestor
Step 5: Hiring5Hiring



Vem pro #TimeCIelo, onde seu sonho de transformação encontra infinitas possibilidades de se tornar realidade!

Somos mais que uma máquina, somos pessoas que sonham, transformam e criam infinitas possibilidades juntas.

Aqui a gente é movido por sonhos e, mais importante, por transformação! Por isso, nos empenhamos todos os dias para cumprir a nosso propósito de simplificar e impulsionar negócios para todas as pessoas, oferecendo soluções financeiras inteligentes e acessíveis que estão no dia a dia de quem movimenta o Brasil.

Para isso, Investimos fortemente em tecnologia, criamos um ambiente propenso ao desenvolvimento e fomentamos a inovação para aumentar cada vez mais a nossa capacidade de criar novos caminhos possíveis e gerar impacto positivo no mundo.

Trabalhar na Cielo é aprender na prática e construir uma carreira diariamente.

No nosso dia a dia, a gente trabalha com autonomia para escrever nossa própria jornada, liberdade para ser quem a gente é e a oportunidade de fazer acontecer.

Nós sonhamos no plural, acolhendo e ajudando a realizar os sonhos das mais de 6.000 pessoas que fazem parte do #TimeCielo. E, para torná-los realidade, a gente oferece uma experiência completa e inesquecível para o nosso time, focando no bem-estar físico e mental não apenas dos nossos colaboradores e colaboradoras, mas também de suas famílias.

Além disso, a gente acredita que a resposta para conseguir vislumbrar novos futuros está na inclusão e acolhimento de todas as pessoas, com suas singularidades e diversidade de vivências. Por isso, não importa qual seja o seu sonho – pra sua vida, sua carreira, pra deixar sua marca no mundo –, tem lugar pra ele aqui, junto com os nossos. Vem pra Cima, vem pra Cielo!

Title: Analista de Melhora Contínua (Dados/SQL) - Mercado Envios
Description:
No Mercado Livre estamos democratizando o comércio e os serviços financeiros para transformar a vida das pessoas na América Latina. Faça parte deste propósito!




No Mercado Envios, administramos o estoque das pessoas que vendem e entregamos os produtos para as que compram, melhorando sua experiência em nossa plataforma. Em um mundo em constante evolução, nossa capacidade para entregar rapidamente os produtos que são comprados através do Mercado Livre tornou-se um requisito para competir. Faça parte da equipe que está liderando a logística na América Latina, oferecendo soluções customizadas de classe mundial e integrando carriers locais e regionais, através de um comércio que não reconhece fronteiras.




Temos um desafio para as pessoas que:

Vibram energia empreendedora: são movidas pela curiosidade, nunca desistem e estão focadas em superar seus próprios limites.
Dão o máximo, porque adoram trabalhar com compromisso e dedicação.
Encaram as mudanças como oportunidades e aprendem com seus erros.
A excelência e a execução são primordiais na sua forma de fazer as coisas.
Promovem o bom clima, a alegria e a diversão.
Sabem como construir com outras pessoas e desfrutam trabalhando em equipe.




Imagine você empreendendo projetos desafiadores, dinâmicos e inovadores, e sendo responsável por:

Identificar e atuar com prioridade em oportunidades de melhoria da operação que sanem as principais dores do ponto de vista de segurança, qualidade e produtividade de acordo com os processos de trabalho definidos;
Cocriar, validar e implementar soluções sistêmicas em conjunto com os times de Process Development, além de garantir a execução da forma de trabalho com os times regionais e com os times parceiros de Excelência Operacional;
Colaborar e buscar replicar benchmarks de outras operações, e também realizar análises de viabilidade operacional e financeira de projetos;
Aplicar e difundir metodologia Lean em projetos de melhoria contínua nos processos de Fullfilment;
Garantir o alinhamento com os times de operação com foco em agilidade para atingir os resultados esperados.




Requisitos:

Formação Superior completa em Engenharia, Administração de Empresas ou similar;
Conhecimento e experiência na utilização de metodologias de melhoria contínua em diversos processos (TPS, Six Sigma, DMAIC, Lean, Kaizen, Design Thinking, Agile, etc.);
Experiência em projetos de melhoria contínua, tendo certificações Belts (Yellow como mínimo) e desejável conhecimento no idioma espanhol e Inglês.
Ter disponibilidade de trabalhar Presencialmente em Cajamar - SP
Conhecimento em Power BI, lOOKER, SQL, EXCEL AVANÇADO




Nós lhe propomos:

Ser parte de uma empresa com espírito empreendedor, na qual adoramos pensar grande e em longo prazo.
Ser protagonista de seu desenvolvimento em um ambiente de oportunidades, aprendizagem, crescimento, expansão e projetos desafiadores.
Compartilhar e aprender em equipe, com excelentes profissionais e especialistas.
Experimentar um excelente clima de trabalho, com o necessário para viver a grande experiência de trabalhar num lugar eleito, em diversas categorias, como Great Place to Work.




Faça parte do nosso time!

O Mercado Livre não faz contato oferecendo oportunidades em troca de pagamento de dinheiro. Você tem acesso a todas as oportunidades abertas no nosso site de carreiras. Caso receba pedidos de dinheiro, desconfie!

Show more
